173.article_body: Sweden will withdraw most of its diplomatic staff from its embassy in Ukraine's Kyiv amid fears of impending Russian invasion, Swedish Foreign Minister Ann Linde was quoted as saying by local media. Embassy may be closed if situation in Ukraine deteriorates further, she said. Security staff, as well as people working on consular matters will remain in embassy, she added.

174.title: PM announces ₹2 lakh aid for family of each Kota accident victim
174.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each to the next of kin of those who died in a road accident in Rajasthan's Kota on Sunday. The injured will be given ₹50,000 each, the Prime Minister's Office said. The compensation will be given from the Prime Minister's National Relief Fund.

175.title: Fire on cargo ship carrying 4,000 luxury cars dies down
175.article_body: A fire on a cargo ship carrying 4,000 luxury cars, including Porsches, Audis and Bentleys, has lost its intensity, an official said. Firefighting teams and technicians might be able to board the vessel to prepare to tow it to either Europe or the Bahamas, the official added. Felicity Ace, which is drifting in Atlantic Ocean, had caught fire on Wednesday.

176.title: Baseless: India after UN tweets Rana Ayyub facing 'judicial harassment'
176.article_body: India on Monday rejected allegations of judicial harassment of journalist Rana Ayyub and called them "baseless and unwarranted" in response to an earlier tweet by the United Nations. "India upholds the rule of law," it added. In reference to the Enforcement Directorate's actions against Ayyub, the UN had said, "relentless misogynistic" and "sectarian attacks" against Ayyub to be investigated.

177.title: Women reluctant to join company boards: Union Finance Minister
177.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said women are reluctant to join company boards. "I have actually made a lot of attempts on my own level as a minister in calling up some people and saying please would you not want to come to a board?" she said. "No, I have not had enough women coming," Sitharaman added.

178.title: Saw more lows than highs, but never sold myself cheap: Sanjay Kapoor
178.article_body: Actor-producer Sanjay Kapoor in an interview has stated that he has seen more lows than highs in his career but he never sold himself cheap. He further said that he didn't do the wrong films for the sake of money but instead went into production. "I only wanted to do good work, collaborate with good actors and directors," Sanjay added.

179.title: Woman told to remove hijab at UCO Bank branch in Bihar, bank responds
179.article_body: A Muslim woman was allegedly asked to remove her hijab for withdrawing money at a UCO Bank branch in Bihar's Begusarai and a video of the same also went viral online. UCO Bank responded to the video by saying it "respects the religious sentiments of citizens...doesn't discriminate...on basis of caste or religion". It said it's checking facts on the issue.

180.title: First look of Chris, Natalie in Thor 4 revealed via action figures
180.article_body: The first look of actors Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman as Thor and Mighty Thor respectively in the upcoming film 'Thor: Love and Thunder' has been revealed via action figures. Chris' figure can be seen wearing a blue outfit with gold details and carrying the Stormbreaker. Natalie's figure carries the Mjolnir hammer and looks similar to the original Thor outfit.

181.title: Vedanta makes oil discovery in Rajasthan's Barmer
181.article_body: Vedanta in a statement said, "We've informed the Petroleum Ministry of an Oil Discovery (named 'Durga') in our exploratory well in Rajasthan's Barmer." The block where the discovery was made was awarded to Vedanta in October 2018 and is one of the 41 blocks awarded to it in OALP-I round of bidding. Vedanta holds 100% participating interest in the block.

182.title: UAE extends grounding of private drones until further notice
182.article_body: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) on Monday extended a decision to ground all private drones and light sports aircraft used for recreational purposes until further notice. The UAE's Interior Ministry had grounded them in January in response to a deadly attack on the country by Yemen's Houthi rebels. The attack had left three people, including two Indian nationals, dead.

183.title: Fraudster Madoff's sister, her husband found dead in apparent murder-suicide in US
183.article_body: The sister of late Bernie Madoff, who was convicted of masterminding the world's largest Ponzi scheme, and her husband have been found dead in Florida. Sondra Wiener, 87, and her husband Marvin were found with gunshot wounds, the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office said, adding that it appeared to be a murder-suicide. Madoff died aged 82 in US prison last year.

184.title: People of all faiths should accept dress code: Shah on hijab row
184.article_body: Amid the ongoing hijab row, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said, "It is my personal belief that people of all religions should accept the school's dress code." Shah also said that the decision of the court should be followed by all. "Ultimately, it has to be decided whether the country will function on the Constitution or whims," he added.

185.title: India is defined as 'Union of States' in Constitution: Rahul
185.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, on Monday, reacted to BJP's criticism of his Parliament speech where he called India a 'Union of States', saying, "This is the definition of...India in the Constitution." While addressing a rally in Manipur, he stated that in BJP's vision, "there's one ideology, one idea, one language that's superior to all other ideas, languages...cultures."

186.title: Woman allegedly murders her 80-yr-old father in Goa, arrested
186.article_body: A woman has been arrested after allegedly murdering her 80-year-old father in a town in south Goa. The woman was arrested by police on Friday after the deceased, identified as Trinidade Martins, was found dead in Varca. The accused was said to have not been on good terms with her father and the two reportedly fought over property disputes regularly.

187.title: Police helicopter crashes in Philippines, 1 killed and 2 injured
187.article_body: Police helicopter, Airbus H125 crashed in Philippines' Quezon province on Monday killing a police officer and injuring two pilots, said a police spokesperson. As per officials, incident took place when the helicopter was en route Balesin island to pick up National Police Chief Gen. Dionardo Carlos. Meanwhile, the officials have ordered the grounding of other helicopters and ordered an inquiry.

188.title: Israel successfully tests its new naval air defence system
188.article_body: Israel on Monday said that it has successfully tested the "C-Dome" system, its new naval air defence system. The new system is a naval version of the Iron Dome missile defence system, which has been used to shoot down rockets fired from the Gaza Strip. Monday's test simulated a number of incoming threats, the Israeli Defence Ministry said.

189.title: 12 people arrested after police raid several dance bars in Jaipur
189.article_body: Twelve people have been arrested by police following raids at several Jaipur dance bars. The raids were reportedly conducted at hotels and dance bars in Shipra Path, Shyam Nagar, Shivdaspura, Ramnagriya, Sanjay Circle and Jalupura areas based on a tip-off received by police. Officers also took as many as 27 people into custody for their alleged involvement in the racket.

190.title: Lithuania aims to boost defence expenditure amid Ukraine crisis: PM
190.article_body: Lithuanian PM Ingrida Šimonytė said on Monday that the country plans to boost its defence expenditure amid heightened tensions of a Russian invasion of Ukraine. "Under the circumstances, financing the defence of the country is the government's priority," she said in a statement. Other countries including Germany and Norway have stationed their troops in Lithuania.

191.title: I don't think that monogamy is healthy: Nick Cannon
191.article_body: Actor-comedian Nick Cannon has said that he doesn't think monogamy is healthy, adding that he feels like it gets in the space of selfishness and ownership. Nick further said that he dislikes the legality of marriages. "Married is not single. When you allow the government and paperwork to come and say 'This is a bond'...you're not single," he added.

192.title: Fat-shaming only applies if you are ashamed of your fat: 50 Cent
192.article_body: Rapper 50 Cent responded to being fat-shamed after his Super Bowl halftime performance, writing on social media, "Fat-shaming only applies when [you are] ashamed of your fat." He also shared a picture of an article titled '50 Cent claps back at his Super Bowl fat-shaming haters with sweet merch'. The rapper further wrote, "I call this teasing me."

193.title: He's definitely a tick for 2022 T20 WC: Ajay Jadeja on Harshal
193.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said India pacer Harshal Patel, who was the second-highest wicket-taker (5) in recently concluded T20I series against West Indies, is definitely "a tick" for 2022 T20 World Cup at this stage. "If you expose him [Harshal] more, he might be less effective. But Australia grounds are huge, where he would be very useful," he added.

194.title: US, Egypt launch joint working group for UN climate change summit
194.article_body: US Special Presidential Envoy for Climate John Kerry and Egyptian Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry on Monday launched a joint working group to prepare for UN's next climate change summit (COP27). Task for this year is to bring more countries on board to set ambitious climate goals, said Kerry. Meanwhile, Shoukry said working group will also support Egypt's energy transition.

195.title: US astronomers discover brown dwarf pair with widest ever separation
195.article_body: US astronomers discovered a rare pair of brown dwarfs with the widest ever separation. Scientists said the two brown dwarfs are about 12 billion miles apart, or thrice the Pluto-Sun distance. With mass less than 0.075 that of the Sun, a brown dwarf is an astronomical object that is larger than a planet but smaller than a star.

196.title: Ex-ISI chief, Pak politicians among those named in Credit Suisse leak
196.article_body: A data leak from Credit Suisse has revealed information about 600 accounts linked to 1,400 Pakistani citizens including politicians and generals. As per a report, ex-ISI chief, General Akhtar Abdur Rahman Khan also held an account and helped transfer billions of dollars "from US and other countries to the mujahedeen in Afghanistan to support their fight against the Soviet Union."

197.title: 'Doctor Strange 2' to introduce new Wolverine to MCU: Report
197.article_body: Movie insider Joseph Deckelmeier on Sunday took to Twitter to announce that the upcoming film 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' will introduce a new actor as Wolverine in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Joseph added that the character will not be portrayed by actor Hugh Jackman. Hugh had portrayed Wolverine for 16 years across eight films.

198.title: Has been nice to see younger guys come through in WI series: Dravid
198.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said it was nice to see the younger players perform in the side's recently concluded limited-overs series against West Indies. "It's been a learning experience. I've learnt a lot," he added. With nine wickets in three matches, 26-year-old pacer Prasidh Krishna was highest wicket-taker in three-match ODI series against West Indies.

199.title: Look within yourself: Bihar Dy CM reacts to Tejashwi's BJP remark
199.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tarkishore Prasad has said that Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav should "look within himself" before accusing BJP of targeting his father Lalu Prasad Yadav in fifth fodder scam case. The CBI court has given its verdict and Indians have faith in judicial system, Prasad added. Tejashwi had alleged that his father is facing imprisonment for opposing BJP.

200.title: BSP is still relevant, Muslims will also vote for it: Amit Shah
200.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah said Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) is still relevant as Jatav votes remained with the party and Muslims would vote for BSP in a number of seats. Whether it'll be an advantage or loss for BJP is seat-specific, Shah said. BSP chief Mayawati keeping a low profile doesn't mean her support base had entirely eroded, he added.

201.title: Farhan & Shibani make first public appearance after their wedding, pics surface
201.article_body: Two days after getting married at a farmhouse in Khandala, Shibani Dandekar and Farhan Akhtar made their first public appearance as husband and wife on Monday. The couple dressed in matching gold and blush pink outfits posed for pictures at Farhan Akhtar's residence in Mumbai and distributed sweets to reporters. They reportedly registered their civil marriage today.

202.title: You feel like cattle: Uthappa as he compares IPL auction to an 'examination'
202.article_body: Chennai Super Kings cricketer Robin Uthappa in an interview revealed that IPL auctions are similar to an "examination" and going for it "you feel like cattle". He said, "It's not the most pleasing feeling...You can't imagine what the guys who don't get sold go through." He further suggested a 'more respectful' draft system to replace the current auction process.

203.title: 'Bachchhan Paandey' was challenging & exciting experience: Farhad
203.article_body: Talking about his film 'Bachchhan Paandey', director Farhad Samji said, "The movie...was a challenging, exciting and a loving experience." "As far as directing the film goes, I had both fun and challenges," he added. The film stars actor Akshay Kumar in the title role. Farhad has previously directed Akshay in 'Entertainment', 'Housefull 3' and 'Housefull 4'.

204.title: Gurus of BSP are sitting in BJP: Akhilesh in UP election rally
204.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday claimed the "gurus" of BSP are sitting in the BJP. "I hope you understand that those who are sitting on elephant (BSP symbol) can go anywhere," Akhilesh said at an election rally. On CM Yogi Adityanath, Akhilesh said, "He is 'bulldozer wale baba'. It's a clear fight between the public and BJP."

205.title: We're excited to play in Women's ODI World Cup: Australia's Lanning
205.article_body: Ahead of the Women's ODI World Cup 2022, Australia captain Meg Lanning said that her team is excited to compete in the upcoming tournament and are going there to win. "It's going to be a pretty tough tournament to play," she stated. Australia have won the Women's ODI World Cup for a record six times.

206.title: Never said Premier League title race was over: Man City's Guardiola
206.article_body: Following Manchester City's 2-3 loss versus Tottenham Hotspur, head coach Pep Guardiola stated that he never said the Premier League title race was over. "It's normal. In January and February...teams at the bottom won their games because everyone fights for everything," Pep added. Liverpool closed the gap with league leaders Manchester City to six points with a game in hand.

207.title: Protests in Guj if cases against quota agitators not withdrawn: Patel
207.article_body: Congress' Hardik Patel has said that a statewide agitation will be held in Gujarat from March 23 if the state government doesn't withdraw pending criminal cases against 2015 Patidar agitation protesters. "There are roughly 200 criminal cases...against nearly 5,000 youths...They...[can't] get passports," he said. The agitation sought reservation under the OBC category for the Patidar community.

208.title: Himachal liquor factory's licence cancelled for flouting norms
208.article_body: The Excise and Taxation Department has cancelled the licence of a liquor factory at Paonta Sahib in Himachal Pradesh's Sirmaur district. The factory had allegedly transported about 900 boxes of liquor without any valid pass/permit, said Excise Commissioner Yunus Khan. A high-level probe found lapses in the manufacturing, handling and transportation of alcohol, he said.

209.title: Man carrying gun outside Alexandra Daddario's home arrested
209.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested outside actress Alexandra Daddario's Hollywood home for carrying a concealed weapon after a gun was found in his vehicle. As per a Deadline report, a call was made from Alexandra's home to emergency line 911 around 11 AM on Saturday. The man reportedly refused to leave the scene and yelled something about the actress.

210.title: Mumbai sees below 100 new COVID-19 cases for 1st time after April 2020
210.article_body: Mumbai on Monday reported less than 100 new COVID-19 cases for the first time after April 17, 2020. In the last 24 hours, the city saw 96 fresh COVID-19 cases and one death, while the number of active cases stood at 1,415. Mumbai had reported 77 new COVID-19 cases and five deaths on April 17, 2020.

211.title: 2 friends stabbed to death in Amritsar, motorcycle snatched
211.article_body: Two friends were stabbed to death and their motorcycle was snatched by three unidentified persons near Chitra Cinema in Amritsar on Sunday. The incident took place at 4.15 am when the victims, Rishubh and Jagdish, were on their way to a hospital along with another friend Dikshit, the police said. A case under Section 302 of IPC has been registered.

212.title: Fire breaks out at apartment complex in Germany, 3 injured
212.article_body: A fire broke out at a five-storey residential apartment complex in Essen, Germany on Sunday, leaving three injured and nearly 100 residents evacuated to a nearby university auditorium. While the cause of the fire has not been ascertained yet, police said the blaze has been brought under control. Meanwhile, the fire department has ordered an investigation into the incident.

213.title: India growing at 9.2%, among fastest-growing large economies: NITI Aayog CEO
213.article_body: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Monday said the Indian economy is growing at 9.2% and is among the fastest-growing large economies in the world. "Today, India is witnessing unprecedented levels of economic development and technological disruptions," he said. The Centre's Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme will add $520 billion to India's output in the next five years, Kant said.

214.title: Ukraine warns of cyberattack on banks, state agencies
214.article_body: Ukraine's cybersecurity agency CERT-UA on Monday warned that hackers were preparing to launch cyberattacks on the country's government agencies, banks and the defence sector on Tuesday. CERT-UA found warnings of the cyberattack on a hacking forum. Russia was likely behind an attack that downed the defence ministry's web portal and disrupted banking and terminal services, Ukraine said last week.

215.title: Even now, I get up at 3 am to delete abusive comments: Ashneer after Shark Tank
215.article_body: BharatPe's Co-Founder Ashneer Grover has said that he still gets abused a lot on social media after appearing as a judge on Shark Tank India. "Even now, I get up at 3 am and sneakily delete abusive comments from my social media," he added. He also said that he blocks users who leave abusive comments on his social media accounts.

216.title: We shouldn't feel disgraced: Pollard on WI's 0-3 T20I series loss vs India
216.article_body: West Indies skipper Kieron Pollard said his side shouldn't be disgraced by their 0-3 whitewash against India in three-match T20I series in Kolkata. "We aren't happy losing, let me put that on record...we're trying to win cricket games...we are a work in progress," he added. India completed a 3-0 clean sweep against West Indies in both ODI and T20I series.

217.title: Kohli fan holds poster saying 'Want to see your century in Pak', Akhtar shares pic
217.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar tweeted a picture of a fan holding a Virat Kohli poster saying, "I want to see your century in Pakistan", during a Pakistan Super League match. "Someone spreading the love at the #GaddafiStadium," said Akhtar on the picture. Many Pakistanis shared the tweet with one saying, "Cricket love [is] beyond the boundary."

218.title: Was a bit nervous but Rohit, Dravid calmed me: Avesh on Team India debut
218.article_body: Pacer Avesh Khan, who made his Team India debut in third T20I against West Indies at Eden Gardens, said he'll try to excel as much as he can for the country. "It was my debut, I was obviously...little nervous. Rohit [Sharma] bhai backed me, Rahul [Dravid] sir told me to enjoy...game," he added. Avesh registered bowling figures of 4-0-42-0.

219.title: Russia says 5 killed for crossing from Ukraine; Kyiv calls it 'fake news'
219.article_body: The Russian military on Monday said it had killed five "saboteurs" who crossed from the Ukrainian territory. Meanwhile, Kyiv dismissed this as fake news and an official from Ukraine's interior ministry said, "Not a single one of our soldiers have crossed the border with the Russian Federation." The US and Russian presidents have tentatively agreed to meet over the situation.

220.title: Brahmāstra expensive, but it's been incredible journey: Dharma CEO
220.article_body: Dharma Productions CEO Apoorva Mehta has called Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmāstra' a very expensive film, adding that it has been an incredible journey. "The whole journey of understanding how to make this high budget VFX film, how to mount them, how to plan for VFX, how to execute...has been...a very difficult journey but extremely rewarding," Apoorva said.

221.title: China sanctions 2 US companies for selling weapons to Taiwan
221.article_body: China sanctioned two US firms, Lockheed Martin and Raytheon Technologies, on Monday over the sale of weapons to Taiwan. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said that the sanctions are "countermeasures" against the firms as the arms deal undermined China's "sovereignty and security interests". The US approved a $100-million weapons sale deal for Taiwan earlier this month.

222.title: IPO-bound LIC may not sell entire stake in IDBI Bank: Chairman
222.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said the IPO-bound insurance company may not sell its entire stake in IDBI Bank. LIC may use the bank's large network of branches to market its insurance services, Kumar said. "[IDBI Bank] has been the strongest contributor to the bancassurance channel for us," he added.

223.title: Revived Iran nuclear deal will make region volatile: Israel's PM
223.article_body: Israel's PM Naftali Bennett on Sunday said that a revived nuclear deal with Iran would create a "more violent, more volatile Middle East". Bennett's comment comes amid negotiations between Iran and the world powers to revive the 2015 nuclear deal in Vienna. Israel has urged negotiators to take a hard line against Iran in the current round of talks.

224.title: Iran's President Raisi arrives in Qatar for gas summit
224.article_body: Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi on Monday arrived in Qatar to attend a major summit of gas exporting countries. It is Raisi's maiden visit to a Gulf country since taking over as the President in August last year. Raisi and Qatar's Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani signed a number of bilateral agreements in Doha.

225.title: Man leaves mentally challenged daughter at Pune station, arrested
225.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police on Saturday arrested a man for abandoning his seven-year-old mentally challenged daughter at the Pune railway station on Thursday morning. The incident came to light after a social worker informed the police, upon learning that the man and his wife abandoned their daughter over "stress" about her future.

226.title: PharmEasy parent gets SEBI's approval for ₹6,250 crore IPO
226.article_body: PharmEasy parent API Holdings has received the Securities and Exchange Board of India's (SEBI) approval for its ₹6,250 crore initial public offering (IPO). According to the company's draft papers, the proceeds will be used to prepay or repay an outstanding debt of ₹1,929 crore. The offer is entirely a fresh issue and its founders and investors will not sell shares.

227.title: Sex racket operating in Pune's Chinchwad busted, 3 women rescued
227.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police rescued three women hailing from Delhi and Chhattisgarh after busting an alleged sex racket running in the Chinchwad area, which contacted customers through WhatsApp, officers said. Inspector Devendra Chavan, head of the security cell of the Pimpri-Chinchwad Police, said that they have launched a search for three men, who are suspected to be running the racket.

228.title: Cyberabad Police uses Rajinikanth's film clip in helmet safety post
228.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police has used a clip from actor Rajinikanth's movie 'Baba' in a post to educate motorists about safe helmets. The force took to its official Twitter handle to share the video while delivering information on the kind of helmets that two-wheeler riders should wear. "Wear a fully-covered and good quality helmet. Be safe," the force wrote.

229.title: Bachchan family, Hema Malini and others attend Anmol Ambani's wedding
229.article_body: Actors Amitabh Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan, Abhishek's sister Shweta Bachchan and Hema Malini were among the celebrities who attended the wedding of businessman Anil Ambani's son Anmol Ambani in Mumbai, on Sunday. Fashion designer Sandeep Khosla was also among the attendees. Philanthropist Pinky Reddy, the wife of GVK Group's GV Sanjay Reddy, also attended the wedding.

230.title: Which routes will the water taxi services in Mumbai operate on?
230.article_body: The first-ever water taxi services between Mumbai and Navi Mumbai will currently be running on three routes. The taxis will transport passengers between Navi Mumbai's Belapur and South Mumbai's Domestic Cruise Terminal (DCT), Belapur and Elephanta and Belapur and Jawaharlal Nehru Port (JNPT). A one-way speed boat ticket is priced between ₹800 to ₹1,200 while a monthly pass costs ₹12,100.

231.title: There's pro-incumbency in UP, BJP will break all records: UP Dy CM
231.article_body: Ahead of fourth phase of polling in UP Assembly elections, UP Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma expressed confidence that BJP will break its previous victory records in state as there's a "pro-incumbency" wave. "We're getting enthusiastic responses wherever we go due to works done by the Yogi government," he said. BJP leaders claim their tally will surpass 2017 figures, he added.

232.title: Lalu facing imprisonment as he is fighting RSS and BJP: RJD chief
232.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Tejashwi Yadav said former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav is facing imprisonment in the fifth fodder scam case as "he is fighting against RSS-BJP". Lalu would've been called Raja Harishchandra if he would have shaken hands with the BJP, Tejashwi said. "Lalu ji has said he would never bow down to the BJP," he added.

233.title: Man promises to double Thane couple's money, runs away with ₹1 lakh
233.article_body: A couple in Thane lost ₹1 lakh after a man promised them to double their money with rituals. The accused first called the couple to an isolated place in Balkum on February 11 and then asked them to chant mantras as part of the rituals. Later, he ran away with their bag which had the money.

234.title: 23-yr-old refuses to greet school senior in Gurugram, stabbed
234.article_body: A 23-year-old man was allegedly stabbed by a former school senior after he refused to greet him at a market near Himgiri Chowk in Gurugram's Sector-10A, police said on Sunday. Police said that the incident took place on Saturday and the victim, identified as Aditya Siwach, received stab wounds on his neck, nose and face.

235.title: Congratulations for another whitewash: Sachin on India's T20I series win
235.article_body: Following India's 3-0 T20I series whitewash against West Indies, Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations to Team India for another whitewash. Well played!" Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag tweeted, "A good series win for Team India. Many positives." It was India's second consecutive whitewash victory in T20Is and fourth under the captaincy of Rohit Sharma.

236.title: Delhi man arrested from Jaipur for allegedly killing 24-yr-old wife
236.article_body: The police on Sunday arrested a 26-year-old Delhi man from Jaipur in connection with the alleged murder of his wife, whose body was found at her friend's house in the national capital on Friday. The victim appears to have been strangulated to death, a police official said. The motive behind the murder is not yet known, the official added.

237.title: OPD services at Gurugram's new medical college from 2023: CM
237.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said that the Out Patient Department (OPD) of the new medical college being built in Gurugram will be operational from September 2023. The Shri Sheetla Mata Devi Medical College and Hospital is being constructed on 30 acres of land in Sector 102. The hospital will have 650 beds, an official said.

238.title: Lakhimpur victims' families move SC challenging Ashish Mishra's bail
238.article_body: The family members of the victims of Lakhimpur Kheri violence have approached the Supreme Court seeking cancellation of bail given to accused Ashish Mishra, who is Union Minister Ajay Mishra's son. Eight people, including four farmers, were killed in the violence on October 3 last year. The plea said the high court didn't consider the "overwhelming evidence" against the accused.

239.title: Will Kashmir be returned to Pandits? Kangana on 'The Kashmir Files'
239.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Monday shared the trailer of Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' on Instagram Stories, writing, "So beautifully done!" She further wrote, "Loved that the maker chooses to go past the past and makes our present the very moment in the end." Kangana concluded, "Kya Kashmir Panditon ko vapas milega (Will Kashmir be returned to Pandits)?"

240.title: We wanted to buy Ishan Kishan in IPL mega auction: SRH's Muralitharan
240.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad's spin bowling coach Muttiah Muralitharan has said that the franchise had planned to buy wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan in the IPL 2022 mega auction. But, he added that they had to look for alternatives once Kishan's bid crossed their budget. "We thought Nicholas Pooran was the right choice once Kishan slipped away," he stated.

241.title: An asset for any captain to have 6th bowling option: Venkatesh
241.article_body: India all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer has said that having a sixth bowling option is an asset to any captain. Venkatesh stated, "I'm trying to play my role...as a finisher. With the ball, I want to give that important couple of overs to the captain." In the third T20I against West Indies, Venkatesh scored an unbeaten 35 runs and took two wickets.

242.title: Time will not be on Pujara-Rahane's side for Test team return: Gavaskar
242.article_body: After Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane's exclusion from India's 18-member squad for Test series against Sri Lanka, Sunil Gavaskar said it was expected, adding time will not be on their side to return to Test team as they'll be in their mid-30s. Pujara and Rahane could manage a single fifty each in six innings of recent South Africa Test series.

243.title: Venkatesh Iyer currently is ahead of Hardik Pandya for T20WC: Jaffer
243.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Venkatesh Iyer currently is ahead of Hardik Pandya for the bowling all-rounder spot in Team India for the upcoming 2022 T20 World Cup. In the T20I series against West Indies, Venkatesh scored 92 runs and scalped two wickets in three matches. "Venkatesh is...ahead because you don't know Hardik, whether he's bowling now," Jaffer stated.

244.title: I don't see Pujara and Rahane coming back in Tests: Ajay Jadeja
244.article_body: Talking about India batters Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane, ex-India player Ajay Jadeja said, "Both are single-format players, and when you leave them out of that one format, I don't see them coming back." This comes after Pujara and Rahane were not included in Team India's Test squad for the two-match home series against Sri Lanka.

245.title: Open to post-poll alliance to keep BJP out of power in UP: AAP
245.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said the party is open to an alliance in Uttar Pradesh in case of a hung Assembly to keep BJP out of power. "Vote for AAP with great enthusiasm," Kejriwal said. He added that BJP and Congress are asking for votes "by calling Kejriwal a terrorist" as they did not work in past 70 years.

246.title: Myanmar urges ASEAN envoy to not engage with 'terrorist' groups
246.article_body: Myanmar junta has criticised calls for the Association of Southeast Asian Nations' (ASEAN) special envoy to the country to engage with bodies that oppose last year's coup, which the junta has termed as "terrorist" groups. The junta said that such a move would "undermine ASEAN's counter-terrorism efforts". This comes after Myanmar skipped the ASEAN Foreign Ministers' meeting held last week.

247.title: Biological E's Corbevax vaccine gets emergency use nod for 12-18 age group
247.article_body: The Drugs Controller General of India on Monday approved Biological E's COVID-19 vaccine Corbevax for emergency use in India for children aged 12 to 18 years. Corbevax will reportedly be administered in two doses. Notably, Corbevax is India's first indigenously developed RBD protein sub-unit vaccine and last year, it was approved for restricted use in emergency situations in adults.

248.title: Pune’s Baburao Sanas Ground to be reserved for athletes only: PMC
248.article_body: The Baburao Sanas Ground in Pune will now be reserved for athletes only, said Ajay Khedekar, president, sports committee, Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). "There were a few incidents where outside coaches were taking special training for police recruitment and it was creating problems for the athletes. So we have taken this decision," he added.

249.title: History-sheeter attacked, robbed of ₹3.23 lakh during walk in Pune
249.article_body: A man who has five criminal cases registered against him was allegedly robbed of ₹3.23 lakh while he had gone for a walk in Pune, police said. The complaint alleged that the accused arrived on a bike and attacked him at the back of his head with a sword. The accused ran away with gold ornaments and ₹3,500 cash.

250.title: Rocket set to crash into Moon on March 4 is not ours, says China
250.article_body: China's foreign ministry on Monday denied US space agency NASA's claim that a spent rocket booster predicted to crash on the Moon on March 4 was debris from a Chinese lunar mission in 2014. China said its rocket had "safely entered Earth's atmosphere and has completely burned". The debris was initially thought to be a used SpaceX rocket stage.

251.title: Hong Kong logs record over 7,000 new COVID-19 cases, 13 deaths in a day
251.article_body: Hong Kong authorities on Monday reported a record 7,533 new daily COVID-19 infections and 13 deaths, including an 11-month old child. The authorities added they will expand its vaccine bubble to include shopping malls and supermarkets. This comes as government is set to launch a "vaccine passport" on February 24, enabling only vaccinated people to enter supermarkets and clubs.

252.title: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince likely to visit Pakistan in March: Report
252.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince, Mohammad bin Salman will likely visit Pakistan in March, reported local media citing official sources. "Pakistan is keen that the Saudi crown prince attends the Pakistan Day parade as a guest of honour on March 23," reported local newspaper. However, report added the two countries were in talks to finalise the date of the visit.

253.title: No nukes, but we have memes: Ukraine's memes on Russia go viral amid conflict
253.article_body: Amid soaring tensions between Russia and Ukraine, the latter's memes on Twitter on the ongoing situation are going viral. While one tweet described "living next to Russia" as the worst kind of headache, another called Russia a "bad neighbour". The curators behind the Twitter handle said, "We may not have nukes, but we have memes. Call it a security memorandum."

254.title: Investors shouldn't worry about govt control post IPO: LIC Chairman
254.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said potential investors shouldn't worry about government control post LIC's IPO as the insurance company's decision are taken by the board, not the government. He added that LIC is well-capitalised and that he doesn't believe it requires capital at the moment.

255.title: Scientists find skull of 'unusual' armless dinosaur in Argentina
255.article_body: Researchers in Argentina discovered a skull of an ‘unusual’ armless dinosaur believed to have lived in Late Cretaceous Era (nearly 70 million years ago). Named as Guemesia ochoai, the study said it was a species of abelisaurs that roamed the present regions of Africa, South America and India. However, scientists found Guemesia ochoai’s braincase was 70% smaller than most abelisaurids.

256.title: No one has right to tell a player he should retire: Rajkumar on Saha saga
256.article_body: Reacting to Wriddhiman Saha controversy, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said the selectors should do their jobs and that no one has the right to tell the player he should retire. Wicketkeeper-batter Saha, who was dropped from India's 18-member squad for upcoming two-match Test series against Sri Lanka, said head coach Rahul Dravid advised him to "think of retirement".

257.title: EU countries to urge bloc's top diplomat to scale up climate action
257.article_body: Foreign Ministers from EU countries on Monday will urge bloc's top diplomat, High Representative for Foreign Affairs Josep Borrell Fontelles, to scale up climate diplomacy and set more ambitious targets for all member states, as per a draft due to be adopted. The draft added EU states should explore partnerships with countries heavily reliant on coal power generation or mining.

258.title: Finnish skier suffers 'frozen' penis during 50 km race at the Winter Olympics
258.article_body: Finland's cross-country skier Remi Lindholm suffered a 'frozen' penis during the men's 50 km mass start race at the Winter Olympics 2022. He needed a heat pack after having spent an hour and 16 minutes on the course. "You can guess which body part was a little bit frozen...it was one of the worst competitions I've been in," Lindholm said.

259.title: Sri Lanka announce their 18-member squad for T20I series against India
259.article_body: Sri Lanka have announced their 18-member squad for T20I series against India, which will begin on February 24. The only new addition to the squad, that lost 1-4 to Australia, is off-spinner Ashian Daniel. All-rounder Wanindu Hasaranga and pacer Binura Fernando, who recently served seven days' isolation after testing COVID-19 positive, have also been named in the Dasun Shanaka-led squad.

260.title: I was thrilled on how audiences reacted: Ayushmann on 2 yrs of 'Shubh...'
260.article_body: As the film 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan' completed two years, Ayushmann took to Instagram and wrote, "I was thrilled with how the audiences reacted to the movie. The acceptance of the film and the...conversation it started about gender equality was...the success of 'Shubh Mangal Zyada Saavdhan'." "We've to strive to make it a better world for everyone," he said.

261.title: Ukraine destroyed our border facility, says Russia; Ukraine calls it 'fake news'
261.article_body: Amid concerns over the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Moscow said on Monday that a shell fired from Ukraine destroyed a border facility used by Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB). It said "an unidentified projectile" from Ukraine destroyed the facility located 150 metres from the Russia-Ukraine border. The Ukrainian military, however, denied the claim, calling it "fake news".

262.title: We tried around 4 looks: Vikrant Massey on his crew cut look in Love Hostel
262.article_body: Ahead of the release of 'Love Hostel', actor Vikrant Massey opened up about his short hair look in the film. He said, "Ashu in Love Hostel is a...different character from what I've ever adopted." "There were about 4 looks...I tried until we found the final one, the crew cut you all saw me carrying in the trailer," he added

263.title: Hyderabad Police book BJP MLA T Raja Singh for 'bulldozer' remark
263.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Sunday booked Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh for threatening UP voters with dire consequences if they didn't vote for BJP in ongoing Assembly polls. Singh said that the houses of those who don't vote for BJP will be identified and demolished. "UP CM Yogi Adityanath has thousands of bulldozers at his disposal," he had also said.

264.title: Who is R Praggnanandhaa, the 16-year-old Indian who defeated Magnus Carlsen?
264.article_body: Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa, who became the third Indian to defeat world number one Magnus Carlsen, was born on August 10, 2005 in Chennai, Tamil Nadu. He is the fifth-youngest chess Grandmaster, attaining the title aged 12 years, 10 months and 13 days. In 2016, Praggnanandhaa had become the then youngest International Master at 10 years, 10 months and 19 days.

265.title: You beat me to it: Mahesh Babu as daughter dances to his song Kalaavathi
265.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu's daughter, Sitara Ghattamaneni, danced to his song Kalaavathi from his upcoming Telugu film 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata'. Taking to Instagram, she shared the video and dedicated it to her father. "My go at #Kalaavathi! This one's for you Nanna," Sitara wrote. Sharing the post on his story, Mahesh Babu wrote, "My star!!! You beat me to it."

266.title: Police registers FIRs over illegal constructions in Gurugram
266.article_body: Gurugram Police on Sunday said that they have registered four FIRs against 15 people and two private firms for allegedly developing illegal colonies and roads on agricultural lands in the Gurugram district. Most of the illegal structures had been demolished by the local authorities, but the offenders had continued with the unauthorised construction, according to the FIRs.

267.title: Which Indians have defeated world number one chess player Magnus Carlsen?
267.article_body: India's 16-year-old chess player Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa became the third Indian Grandmaster to defeat world number one Magnus Carlsen after defeating him in 39 moves at the Airthings Masters, a 16-player online rapid tournament. The other two Indians to defeat Carlsen in official tournament matches are Viswanathan Anand and Pentala Harikrishna. Carlsen has been world number one since July 2011.

268.title: Cinema not just about heroism, great characters get noticed: Bobby
268.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol in an interview has stated that cinema is not just about heroism, adding that if you are a part of a project with stars and have a great character to play, you also get noticed. "It's about how much people enjoy them after watching the project and how the character has stayed in their mind," he added.

269.title: Physical infidelity bad, but emotional infidelity more hurtful: Deepika
269.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, on being asked if cheating is a big deal anymore, said that she doesn't endorse it, adding, "Emotional infidelity is far more hurtful than anything else." She said that relationships are based on connections and if that connection is lost then there is no relationship. "I'd be far more disappointed if there was emotional infidelity," Deepika added.

270.title: Akhilesh will remain 'babua' throughout his life: UP CM Adityanath
270.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said SP chief Akhilesh Yadav will remain a 'babua' (child) throughout his life. Adityanath was replying to Yadav's comments that Adityanath delayed the distribution of tablets and smartphones as he cannot operate gadgets himself. "Such comments are devoid of 'sanskar' and 'sanskriti' (value and culture)," Adityanath added.

271.title: Protest erupts over Bajrang Dal activist's murder in K'taka; police use tear gas
271.article_body: Vehicles were allegedly set on fire and isolated incidents of stone-pelting were reported as protests over the murder of a Bajrang Dal activist turned violent in Karnataka's Shivamogga. As per reports, the incidents of violence prompted the police to use tear gas to disperse protesters. Police have arrested at least two persons in connection with Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's murder.

272.title: Need to be ready to bowl in death overs: Shardul on India's 3-0 T20Is win
272.article_body: India all-rounder Shardul Thakur, who took two wickets in third India-West Indies T20I, said every bowler in his side should be ready to bowl in the death overs. "You've to be ready to use your variations, you are going to go for runs but one six or four shouldn't play on your mind. We've to be mentally tough," he added.

273.title: Smriti Irani completes Cambridge University course at 45, shares post
273.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani aged 45, has completed a course titled 'Business Analytics: Decision Making Using Data' from the University of Cambridge. Sharing a photo of the certificate she wrote, "To be purposeful has been at the core of my being... to live my realities...and continue to learn has been my endeavour.. sharing one more experience of living and learning."

274.title: Juhi wishes daughter on b'day, pledges to plant 500 trees in her name
274.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla took to Instagram on Monday to wish her daughter, Jahnavi Mehta, on her birthday. Sharing a picture of herself with her daughter, Juhi wrote, "Happy Happy Birthday Jahnavi!! 500 trees for your special day..!! May God Bless you and shower you with all his love. Big hug from all of us." Jahnavi turned 21 on Monday.

275.title: SP chief wears spectacles of religion and caste: Amit Shah
275.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah on Monday said Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav "sees caste from one glass of his spectacles, and religion from the other". Shah said Yadav cannot see anything in people other than religion and caste. "Only Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas politics can do good for UP," he added.

276.title: China asks biggest state-owned banks to report exposure to Jack Ma's Ant Group: Report
276.article_body: Chinese authorities have asked the biggest state-owned firms and banks to conduct thorough checks on their financial exposure and other links to billionaire Jack Ma's Ant Group and report the findings, reported Bloomberg. This is reportedly the most thorough and wide-ranging scrutiny into Ant's deals. In 2020, China suspended Ant's $35-billion IPO that was set to be the world's largest.

277.title: Youngsters don't want to settle for something they're not satisfied with: Ananya
277.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday responded to the notion that the present generation goes from one relationship to the next. She added that youngsters don't want to "settle" for something that they are not fully satisfied with. "I don't think that should be taken in a bad way as well. I probably don't see it in a casual sense," Ananya said.

278.title: Military jet crashes into school in Iran; 3 dead
278.article_body: Three persons were killed when a US-built F5 military jet being used by Iran reportedly crashed into a school wall in Tabriz city on Monday. Among the deceased were two pilots of the aircraft and a civilian who happened to be driving by. The Army said that the school was closed at the time of the accident.

279.title: Viral pic of Shah Rukh Khan with long hair and a beard is photoshopped
279.article_body: A photoshopped picture of actor Shah Rukh Khan showing him with long hair and a salt-and-pepper beard has gone viral online. The picture was taken by Dabboo Ratnani in 2017 and the celebrity photographer shared the original after the altered picture was widely shared. Many of Shah Rukh's fans claimed that this was the actor's 'new look'.

280.title: Which Indians have defeated world number one chess player Magnus Carlsen?
280.article_body: India's 16-year-old chess player Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa became the third Indian Grandmaster to defeat world number one Magnus Carlsen after defeating him in 39 moves at the Airthings Masters, a 16-player online rapid tournament. The other two Indians to defeat Carlsen in official tournament matches are Viswanathan Anand and Pentala Harikrishna. Carlsen has been world number one since July 2021.

281.title: Bhumi Pednekar wraps up shooting for 'Bhakshak' in 39 days
281.article_body: Bhumi Pednekar took to Twitter on Monday to share that she has completed filming for her upcoming film 'Bhakshak'. She wrote, "It has been an emotional roller-coaster, and 39 days later, we wrap #Bhakshak." She added that the film will always remain close to her heart. 'Bhakshak' is directed by Pulkit and produced by Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment.

282.title: SP has given full protection to terrorists: BJP Spokesperson
282.article_body: BJP Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla on Monday said, "The Samajwadi Party (SP) has given protection to terrorists on its cycles." He said, "In 2006, SP said the Students' Islamic Movement of India is not a terror outfit. Did [SP] not work to support terrorism?" Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath also said SP is "playing with the security of the country".

283.title: Lamborghini Huracan blown up by artist for NFT project; video released
283.article_body: Pseudonymous conceptual artist SHL0MS has announced that they have blown up a Lamborghini Huracan sports car for an NFT art project. The car was blown up at an undisclosed desert location. As many as 999 fragments of the car were meticulously categorised, documented, and filmed in stunning rotating videos and each individual video piece will be sold as an NFT.

284.title: Premature to talk about any plans for summits: Russia on Biden-Putin meet
284.article_body: Russia has said it's "premature" to talk about any plans for any kind of summits after France President Emmanuel Macron's office said that both Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Joe Biden were open to the idea amid Ukraine crisis. "There is an understanding that dialogue should be continued at the level of foreign ministers," the Kremlin spokesperson added.

285.title: Man dies after inhaling gas from geyser inside bathroom at Gurugram hotel
285.article_body: A man was found dead inside the bathroom of a hotel room in Gurugram after allegedly inhaling gas from a geyser, police said on Monday. The hotel's owner and manager have been booked. The complainant, who was staying at the same hotel, said the bathroom door was broken after the victim didn't come out even after 25 minutes.

286.title: 'Badhaai Do' actress Chum Darang felicitated by Arunachal Pradesh CM
286.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu felicitated actress Chum Darang who was recently seen in Rajkummar Rao and Bhumi Pednekar-starrer comedy film 'Badhaai Do'. She shared a few pictures on her Instagram handle, writing, "Being lauded for something that you've put your heart and soul into feels amazing." 'Badhaai Do' marked Chum Darang's debut in the Hindi film industry.

287.title: 10 more weather stations to be set up in Pune before monsoon
287.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) will install at least ten more Automatic Weather Stations (AWS) in the Pune district, in addition to those already installed at 25 locations, for round-the-clock monitoring. The AWS records key parameters like temperature, rainfall, humidity, etc. KS Hosalikar, Climate Research and Services head of IMD, Pune, said installation work will end before monsoon.

288.title: 76 arrested for violence amid Odisha rural polls; re-polling declared at 45 booths
288.article_body: Several incidents of violence and attempts of booth capturing were reported during the ongoing panchayat elections in Odisha. The State Election Commission (SEC) has announced re-polling at 45 booths across Jajpur, Kendrapara, Puri and Dhenkanal districts, where the voting process was disrupted due to violence. Police have arrested 76 people from these districts in connection with violence.

289.title: Driver runs away with ATM refill van carrying ₹35 lakh cash in Hyd
289.article_body: A driver of a cash transit vehicle ran away with ₹35 lakh cash meant for refilling an ATM machine in Hyderabad. Police are now searching for the driver of the cash logistics management company following the incident at Dundigal on Saturday. The vehicle was reportedly traced in the nearby forest area but the accused driver fled with the cash bag.

290.title: 16-year-old girl missing from West Bengal found in Gurugram
290.article_body: A 16-year-old girl who was reported to be missing by her parents in West Bengal was recused by Gurugram Police from Tigra village in Sector 57. The girl had left her home to meet a 23-year-old boy from Gurugram, according to the police. The girl and the boy had known each other for a long time, the police said.

291.title: 48 kg cannabis seized in UP's Shamli district, 2 arrested
291.article_body: The police in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district seized 48 kg of cannabis and arrested two suspected smugglers, officials said on Monday. The suspects were identified as Satbir and Shakil. SSP Sukirti Madhav said the drugs were seized after the police intercepted a car during regular checking. The car has also been impounded.

292.title: You last held my hand when I was leaving for 'Baarish' shoot: Hina on late father
292.article_body: Actress Hina Khan took to Instagram to post pictures with her late father and share that it has been ten months since he passed away. She wrote, "Last it was when you held my hand, hugged me, dropped me to elevator...while I was leaving for shoot for Baarish...Ten months today. Miss you in everything..I feel you in everything and everyone."

293.title: Tom Cruise had a terrible temper; he threw an album hard at me: Ex-manager
293.article_body: Tom Cruise's ex-manager Eileen Berlin spoke about the actor's temper issues in the early stages of his career. She said, "Tommy had a terrible temper. He harboured...lot of anger at his natural father. He would get angry in a snap of your fingers." She added that once he threw an album at her and it hit her on the cheek.

294.title: Fog hits flight services at Kolkata airport, many passengers stuck
294.article_body: Dense fog disrupted flight operations at the Kolkata airport on Monday morning, following which many passengers were stranded. Officials said no flight could take off or land at the Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport in the city as a thick blanket of fog engulfed the area. The flights that were supposed to land were diverted to nearby airports.

295.title: Police look for 14 women who escaped from rescue home in Hyderabad
295.article_body: Police are searching for 14 women who escaped from a Hyderabad rescue home after reportedly breaking open metal grills and mesh of the window. The runaway inmates housed at Ujwala Rescue Home in Hydershakote, Narsingi, escaped in the early hours on Friday. KGNMT's P Padmavathi said they might have fled as they were scared of being stuck there for long.

296.title: Don't play with people's lives in eastern Ukraine: Germany to Russia
296.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock has accused Russia of playing an "irresponsible" game with the civilian population of eastern Ukraine's Donbas amid ongoing tensions in the region. Baerbock's comments came after sporadic shelling was reported in Donbas' Donetsk on Saturday, which is controlled by pro-Russian separatists. Two soldiers were killed in the shelling, Ukrainian Army had said.

297.title: 35-year-old milkman found dead in Delhi's Rohini
297.article_body: A 35-year-old milkman was found dead on the Heliport road in Delhi's Rohini area on Monday, the police said. After information regarding the presence of a body was received, the Begumpur police station SHO reached the spot. The deceased has been identified as Pradeep, a resident of Rithala. His motorcycle was also found at the spot.

298.title: Oversized white table in Putin's pics costs around ₹84 lakh, says its designer
298.article_body: The 12-ft-long white table, which was seen in pictures of Russian President Vladimir Putin's various meetings, was provided to the Kremlin in 1995. Renato Pologna, whose company Oak designed the table, said that even bigger tables were designed for Kremlin as part of the contract. He added that a similar table would cost around €100,000 (around ₹84 lakh) today.

299.title: Evangeline requests Canadian PM to meet vaccine mandate protesters
299.article_body: Actress Evangeline Lilly has requested Canadian PM Justin Trudeau to meet the groups protesting over vaccine mandates and pandemic restrictions in the country. "They have asked to meet with you, Prime Minister...intelligent, loving, concerned citizens. Why won't you sit with them?" Evangeline says in a video. Protesters have demanded that the authorities remove COVID-19 restrictions in Canada.

300.title: 12 lakh govt positions vacant but jobs not given: Sonia Gandhi
300.article_body: Campaigning for UP polls, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Monday accused the government of failing to provide jobs to youth despite lakhs of vacant positions. "Youth study and prepare for jobs but the BJP government made you sit at home. 12 lakh government jobs are vacant but you've not been given jobs," said Gandhi in a virtual address.

301.title: Under BJP's rule, industrialists loot banks and run away: SP chief
301.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav said the BJP government "isn't a government for the poor, but for the rich". Speaking at a public rally in Raebareli, Yadav said, "We won't get a loan easily...but big industrialists ran away after looting banks." He added, "Be alert, BJP can do anything as they're going to lose UP polls."

302.title: Haryana govt cancels board exams for classes 5 and 8 for this session
302.article_body: The Haryana government on Monday announced that it will not conduct board examination for classes 5 and 8 for this session. Chief Minister Manohar Lal said board exams for the two classes will be held from the next session. "The examinations of both CBSE and Board of School Education Haryana (BSEH) have been postponed for the time being," he added.

303.title: CPI(M) worker hacked to death in Kerala's Kannur; party blames RSS, BJP
303.article_body: A 54-year-old CPI(M) worker was allegedly hacked to death by some assailants in front of his house near Thalassery in Kerala's Kannur on Monday early morning, police said. The incident took place when the victim was home after fishing, police added. CPI(M) has called it a "political murder" and blamed a group of RSS and BJP workers for the killing.

304.title: Kartik, Ranbir, Shraddha seen in all-white at Luv Ranjan's wedding
304.article_body: Pictures of actors Kartik Aaryan, Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor among others have surfaced dressed in all-white for filmmaker Luv Ranjan's wedding in Agra. Actress Rakul Preet Singh and boyfriend Jackky Bhagnani were clicked holding hands. Additionally, actors Arjun Kapoor and Varun Sharma were seen arriving dressed casually. Luv got married to his longtime girlfriend Alisha Vaid on Sunday.

305.title: They said you look 'sick': Bobby on sons' reaction to his 'Love Hostel' look
305.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol, speaking about his look in the upcoming film 'Love Hostel', said, "Many people were taken aback as they never imagined that I looked so fearful and evil." He added that the best reaction came from his sons, Aryaman Deol and Dharam Deol. "[They] told me you look 'sick', which is the new terminology for cool," said Bobby.

306.title: Google settles lawsuit by ex-manager alleging pregnancy discrimination in US
306.article_body: Google has reached a settlement with a former US employee who had alleged that she faced discrimination by the company after she became pregnant with her second child. Chelsey Glasson, a former manager at Google, said her experience at the company left her with insomnia, panic attacks and heart palpitations. She confirmed the settlement to Bloomberg but didn't provide details.

307.title: Caste-based census in Bihar will benefit everyone: CM Nitish Kumar
307.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said on Monday that the state government is committed to doing a caste-based census in the state. "We want to hold an all-party meeting to take everyone's ideas, their experience as to how to do it. It will benefit everyone," he said. The government will ensure that the caste-based census is implemented properly, he added.

308.title: BJP-RSS come to Manipur with sense of superiority: Rahul Gandhi
308.article_body: Ahead of upcoming Assembly polls in Manipur, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said BJP and RSS leaders come to the state with a sense of superiority. "When BJP and RSS come to Manipur, they do not come with respect or understanding. They come with a sense of superiority...I come here with humility," Gandhi stated in Imphal.

309.title: GHMC completes partial rejuvenation of Hyderbad's Langar Houz lake
309.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) completed the first phase of rejuvenation of the Langar Houz lake on Friday. The civic body has cleared the lake of hyacinth and other trash, GHMC Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal tweeted. Beautification work, including a walking track around the lake and an increase in green cover, will be completed in the second phase, Gadwal added.

310.title: B'luru bans protests near institutions till March 8 amid hijab issue
310.article_body: Amid the hijab controversy, Bengaluru Police has extended the ban on protests within a 200-metre radius of any school, college and other educational institutions till March 8. The ban was first imposed on February 9. "Since the issue is still alive and the possibility of holding protests, for and against the same...cannot be ruled out," an order said.

311.title: Elephant rescued from ditch by filling it with water in WB, IFS officer shares clip
311.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan shared a video of the rescue of an elephant who had fallen in a ditch in West Bengal. Kaswan said the Forest Department applied Archimedes' principle (filled the ditch with water to raise the animal upwards) in the rescue. The rescue of the elephant was completed at 4 am, Kaswan said.

312.title: Responsibility is always put on daughters; have seen it happen at home: Navya
312.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda addressed the prevalence of patriarchy in a joint family setup. She said, "I've seen this happen at my home where if guests are over, my mother would always tell me to fetch something or the other." Navya added in big families, the responsibility of how to run the house is always put on daughters.

313.title: Actor Pawan Kalyan falls on car's roof after fan jumps to hug him, video surfaces
313.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actor Pawan Kalyan falling down on the car's roof after a fan jumped to hug him. Pawan Kalyan was greeting his fans in Narasapuram when he climbed to the car's roof from the sunroof to give fans a glimpse of him. The fan then suddenly appeared from behind after which the actor tripped.

314.title: Eventually, I think I would get into politics: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover
314.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover, when asked about his future plans, said, "A few things are in the works. Eventually, I think I would get into politics at some point in time." He said, "When you build a business, you generate a certain employment and impact a certain number of people." He added, "The bigger impact...is by getting into nation-building."

315.title: You have to enjoy moment when you've been so near death: Sonali on cancer
315.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre, while talking about her battle with cancer, said she sometimes gets insecure about her looks but then tells herself that it's not the only thing about her. "It's about what I am...and what I bring to the table," Sonali said, adding, "I have understood you have to be in moment...enjoy it...especially when you've been so near death."

316.title: SDMC opens 'Nigam Haat' to promote waste recycling in Sarita Vihar
316.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) has inaugurated a 'Nigam Haat' in Sarita Vihar with an aim to promote the reduction and recycling of waste at the source. Over 30 eco-friendly products, made from unused and abandoned items, will be available at the shop, a senior municipal official said. This is the second such shop set up by the SDMC.

317.title: No question of water cuts this summer in Pune, says civic body
317.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has said that water cuts in the city are unlikely this summer season. "We will be distributing water judiciously and so with the present water stock there is no question of water cuts," said the head of water resources at PMC's water department. Another official said the water levels are good for Pune city.

318.title: Nisha Rawal confirmed as first contestant of Kangana's 'Lock Upp'
318.article_body: Television actress Nisha Rawal has been announced as the first contestant of reality television show 'Lock Upp: Badass Jail, Atyaachaari Khel'. In the promo video, Nisha is seen in handcuffs wearing an orange jumpsuit. She is charged with 'controversial fights'. "I'm very excited to make this...challenging journey...This show will set a new benchmark in the Indian OTT industry," Nisha said.

319.title: I'm an actor who happens to be deaf: Troy Kotsur on Oscar nomination
319.article_body: Actor Troy Kotsur, who is the first deaf actor to receive an Oscar nomination for Best Supporting Role, has said that he is an actor who happens to be deaf. Troy portrays a deaf fisherman in 'CODA' who relies on his hearing daughter to translate for him. "I'm sure...deaf community...[is] very excited...because awareness has been increased of them," Troy said.

320.title: Wanted to replicate what I did in 1st T20I: Suryakumar on his 65 in 3rd T20I
320.article_body: Talking about his 31-ball 65 in India's 17-run win against West Indies in third T20I, India batter Suryakumar Yadav said he wanted to replicate what he did in the first T20I. Suryakumar had scored 18-ball 34* in first match at Eden Gardens. He was adjudged 'Player of the Series'. India completed a 3-0 whitewash against West Indies in T20I series.

321.title: BA.2 is sub-lineage of Omicron, won’t infect people who had BA.1: IMA official
321.article_body: Co-Chairman National IMA COVID-19 Task Force, Dr Rajeev Jayadevan, said that BA.2 is a sub-lineage of Omicron and is not capable of infecting people who had BA.1. "It's not a new virus or strain. It's a sub-lineage and will be more transmissible than BA.1 but will not cause another surge," Jayadevan added.

322.title: Fire breaks out at Hotel Sea Princess in Mumbai, no one injured
322.article_body: A fire was reported on the first floor of the five-star Hotel Sea Princess in Mumbai's Juhu on Monday. No injury was reported in the incident. The fire broke out around 10.30 am and fire brigade officials reached the spot and extinguished the fire around 11 am, an official of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation said.

323.title: Beijing adds fertility services to insurance to encourage more births
323.article_body: Beijing will include 16 fertility services in a government-backed medical insurance coverage scheme to encourage more births amid record-low birth rate in China, local media has reported. Services using assisted reproductive technologies will reportedly be covered by the insurance from March 26 onwards. China's birthrate dropped from 8.52 (births per 1,000 people) in 2020 to 7.52 in 2021.

324.title: Glass tumbler removed from man’s colon in Bihar, he says 'swallowed with tea'
324.article_body: Doctors in Bihar removed a glass tumbler from the colon of a 55-year-old man who had been suffering from acute constipation and abdominal pain. Speaking about the case, Dr Makhdulul Haq, who headed the team of surgeons said, "The patient said he swallowed the tumbler while having tea. That is, however, not a convincing explanation."

325.title: Ranveer dedicates Best Actor award to 'Kapil's devils', 83 cast
325.article_body: Ranveer Singh, who was named Best Actor at Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards on Sunday for his performance in '83', has dedicated the award to the "legacy of Kapil (Dev's) devils". "I share this award with...cast and crew of 83," he added. The film, directed by Kabir Khan, is based on India's win in the 1983 Cricket World Cup.

326.title: COVID-19 booster rollout too slow, say majority of Japanese: Survey
326.article_body: A survey has found that a majority of Japanese think that the rollout of the COVID-19 booster shots have been too slow in the country. While 73% of the survey respondents said the rollout was slow, 54.1% of them still approved the overall handling of the pandemic. About 14.4% of the population has reportedly received booster shots so far.

327.title: 134 flights, 683 trains cancelled in Japan due to bad weather
327.article_body: As many as 134 flights and 683 trains were reportedly cancelled in Japan's Hokkaido island due to bad weather on Monday. Strong winds with speed up to 138 feet per second combined with heavy snowfall were witnessed in the region including the island's capital Sapporo. In many areas, the snow cover was reported to be as deep as 38 inches.

328.title: What were the top individual scores in Ranji Trophy's first round?
328.article_body: Bihar's 22-year-old batter Sakibul Gani registered the highest individual score in Ranji Trophy's first round by scoring 341 in the first innings against Mizoram. The second highest individual score in the round was registered by Mumbai's Sarfaraz Khan, who scored 275 runs against Saurashtra. Bihar's Babul Kumar scored an unbeaten 229, while Maharashtra opener Pavan Shah scored 219.

329.title: Auto driver takes 24-year-old nurse to isolated area in Mumbai, flashes himself to her
329.article_body: Mumbai police have arrested an auto-rickshaw driver for allegedly molesting a 24-year-old nurse. The auto-rickshaw driver reportedly took the nurse to an isolated place where he stopped the vehicle and flashed himself to her. When she started screaming and running, he molested her. The incident occurred on February 17, when the nurse was returning from night duty.

330.title: Credit Suisse denies alleged wrongdoing after client data gets leaked
330.article_body: Credit Suisse said it "strongly rejects" allegations of wrongdoing after media outlets published findings of investigations into a leak of data on the bank's accounts. The bank allegedly has human rights abusers and businessmen who had been placed under sanctions as its clients. The bank said about 90% of the reviewed accounts are either closed or in process of closure.

331.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav sentenced to 5 yrs in jail, fined ₹60 lakh in 5th fodder scam case
331.article_body: A special CBI court in Jharkhand's Ranchi on Monday sentenced former Bihar CM and Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav to five years imprisonment in the fifth fodder scam case. The court has also slapped a fine of ₹60 lakh on him in connection with the case. The court had convicted Lalu in the case on February 15.

332.title: Model Chrissy reveals undergoing IVF cycle, says 'Stop asking people if they're pregnant'
332.article_body: Model Chrissy Teigen announced she is undergoing another IVF cycle, almost a year after losing her son Jack during pregnancy loss. She wrote, "I humbly beg you to stop asking if I'm pregnant...[W]hile I know it’s said with...good intentions...it just kind of sucks to hear because I'm the opposite of pregnant...Also like please stop asking people.. if they’re pregnant."

333.title: All batters can take a leaf out of his book: Kieron Pollard on Suryakumar Yadav
333.article_body: Praising Suryakumar Yadav, who slammed 65 runs off 31 deliveries in the third T20I, West Indies captain Kieron Pollard said, "He is a world-class player. He is doing great things for himself and India as a 360-degree player." Pollard added, "All batters can take a leaf out of his book." Suryakumar was named Player of the Series.

334.title: He was in touch with 70-75 other women: Police on Odisha man who married 27 women
334.article_body: Police said that Bibhu Prakash Swain, the man arrested from Odisha for marrying at least 27 women in 10 states, "was in touch with 70-75 other women whom he could've married". "He preyed on unsuspecting women looking for security and love," police said. He also defrauded 13 banks in Kerala of ₹1 crore through 128 forged credit cards in 2006.

335.title: Dr Lal PathLabs, Metropolis and other labs' shares fall as COVID-19 eases
335.article_body: The shares of listed Indian clinical labs including Dr Lal PathLabs and Metropolis Healthcare have fallen at least 30% this year as COVID-19 testing reduced due to the easing of the outbreak. The stock of Thyrocare Technologies has already lost a fifth of its value in 2022. Shares of these companies had at least doubled in the previous two years.

336.title: Flipkart to sell Cleartrip's Middle East business to Wego
336.article_body: Flipkart has signed a definitive agreement with Wego, a Singapore-headquartered online travel marketplace, to sell Cleartrip's Middle East business. The transaction also includes the sale of Flyin.com and a technology cooperation agreement between Wego and Flipkart. The deal has been approved by the directors of both companies and is expected to close in the second half of 2022.

337.title: Anil Kapoor, son Harsh Varrdhan team up for thriller film 'Thar'
337.article_body: Anil Kapoor and his actor son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor are teaming up for a revenge thriller film, titled 'Thar'. The forthcoming project, produced by Anil Kapoor Film Company (AKFC), marks the directorial debut of Raj Singh Chaudhary who has also written the film. 'Thar' also stars Fatima Sana Shaikh and Satish Kaushik.

338.title: On March 10, Akhilesh will say 'EVM bewafa hai': Anurag Thakur on polls
338.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav will not be able to "cross even 100 after seven phases". "On 10th March (counting of votes), he'll say 'EVM bewafa hai'. He'll lose from Karhal too. SP's 'gunda raj', 'mafia raj' and collusion with terrorists will not be accepted by people," Thakur said.

339.title: Got famous after Tezaab's release; a kid asked me 'Are you Ek Do Teen': Madhuri
339.article_body: Madhuri Dixit recalled she became famous after the release of her film 'Tezaab' in which she played 'Mohini' and was known for her song 'Ek Do Teen'. She said, "There were...kids running around and then one of them spotted me. He...asked, excitedly, 'Are you Ek Do Teen? Can I have an autograph?' So I gave him an autograph," she said.

340.title: 9-yr-old girl dies after her hair gets stuck in swimming pool drain in Brazil
340.article_body: A nine-year-old girl died in Brazil after her hair got sucked in the drain of a swimming pool during her grandmother’s birthday party. Mariana dos Anjos Faria was swimming in the resort pool when the incident took place and wasn't breathing when she was pulled out. While her father tried to resuscitate her, she was declared dead at the hospital.

341.title: BJP, Cong wanted such incident: Ex-K'taka CM on activist's murder
341.article_body: Former Chief Minister of Karnataka and Janta Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy said that he had predicted a development like the murder of the Bajrang Dal activist when the hijab row had begun in the state. "We saw the death of boy...This is the achievement of Congress and BJP...They destabilised peace of state...They wanted this kind of incident," he said.

342.title: Missing 14-yr-old's decomposing body found in gunny bag in Delhi; 1 held for rape
342.article_body: A week after a 14-year-old girl went missing, Delhi Police has found her decomposing body in a gunny bag in Delhi's Narela area. According to police, the deceased was allegedly gang-raped by two men, who had managed to escape after committing the crime on February 12. One of the accused has been arrested from Sannoth village in Narela, police added.

343.title: 'The Suicide Squad' director James Gunn gets engaged to actress Jennifer Holland
343.article_body: 'The Suicide Squad' director James Gunn took to Instagram to announce his engagement to longtime girlfriend and actress Jennifer Holland. The duo have been in a relationship since 2015. Holland has starred in several of Gunn's projects. She played Emilia Harcourt in 'The Suicide Squad' and also reprised that role in 'Peacemaker'.

344.title: Ranveer Singh shares pic of him fist bumping LeBron James, says 'I am shook'
344.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who played the NBA All-Star Game recently, took to Instagram to share a picture of him fist bumping four-time NBA champion LeBron James. "The King and I...What a precious moment...I am shook!" Ranveer captioned the picture. Commenting on it, actor Tiger Shroff wrote, "Legendary moment" while Sophie Choudry wrote, "Epic."

345.title: That so called journalist needs to be exposed: Parthiv on journalist threatening Saha
345.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha shared a screenshot of threatening texts sent to him by a journalist, ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel tweeted, "A 'journalist' threatening a player and that too an India player for an interview must be new and certainly a low point." He added, "That so called journalist needs to be exposed so...entire community doesn’t get a bad name."

346.title: 7 arrested in Mumbai with mephedrone worth ₹25 lakh, 200 cough syrup bottles
346.article_body: Seven persons were arrested with mephedrone (MD) worth ₹25 lakh and 200 bottles of cough syrup in two operations conducted in Mumbai, police said. While a man was arrested with 250 grams of MD in Ghatkopar, police arrested six persons from Govandi with cough syrup bottles. The accused were supplying cough syrup for illegal sale as an intoxicant, police added.

347.title: Digital divide is rapidly shrinking in India: PM Narendra Modi
347.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that the digital divide is rapidly shrinking in India. "Digital connectivity is what kept our education system alive in this time of a global pandemic…Innovation is ensuring our inclusion," PM Modi added. He addressed a webinar virtually on 'Post budget seminar: Fostering strong industry-skill linkage.'

348.title: Who is Anmol Ambani's wife Khrisha Shah?
348.article_body: Businessman Anil Ambani and Tina Ambani's son Anmol Ambani has got married to Khrisha Shah. According to reports, Shah was born and brought up in Mumbai and is a social worker and entrepreneur. She founded Dysco, a social network company.
