She was earlier an employee of Accenture in the UK and later returned to India to become an entrepreneur.

349.title: Feels like yesterday: Mohnish Bahl on mother Nutan's 31st death anniversary
349.article_body: Actor Mohnish Bahl took to Instagram to share late mother Nutan's picture on her 31st death anniversary. "Feels like yesterday," he captioned the picture. Several fans also took to the comment section to pay tributes to the late actress. "Remembering gorgeous leading lady of yesteryear, one of the finest actresses of Indian cinema, #Nutan ji," one wrote.

350.title: K'taka HM should resign: Siddaramaiah on Bajrang Dal activist's killing
350.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah condemned the alleged murder of Bajrang Dal activist named Harsha in Karnataka’s Shivamogga. "It took place in the district from where the Home Minister and CM come. The culprit should be hanged. I demand the state Home Minister’s resignation," Siddaramaiah added. Following the incident, Shivamogga Deputy Commissioner said that Section 144 has been imposed in the area.

351.title: My father's beaming with joy on anything to do with sport, me: Deepika on '83'
351.article_body: Talking about her and husband Ranveer Singh's film '83' and how her father Prakash Padukone reacted to it, Deepika Padukone said, "Anything to do with sport...anything to do with me...my father is always beaming with pride...and joy." She also said while her family is proud of her, they are also critical. She said her mother and sister are "brutally honest".

352.title: I give my son & daughter-in-law space; don't interfere in their matters: Mithun
352.article_body: Speaking about his son Mimoh Chakraborty and his daughter-in-law Madalsa Sharma, veteran actor Mithun Chakraborty said that he doesn't interfere in their matters. He added, "Madalsa has become a big star now with her show 'Anupama'." "It's good to have her home. But my wife and I give them their space," Mithun said.

353.title: Stand united else 2023 Assembly polls will be last in MP: Digvijaya to Cong workers
353.article_body: In a viral video, Congress leader Digvijaya Singh asked party workers to stand united for the 2023 Assembly polls in MP. "You're not ready to sit together...This will not do. I am telling you the election of 2023 will be the last one. If you won't contest elections honestly then be ready to sit at home," Singh added.

354.title: Australia fully reopens borders for vaccinated international travellers
354.article_body: After nearly two years of stringent COVID-19 curbs, Australia fully reopened its borders for vaccinated international travellers on Monday. "It is a very exciting day, one that I have been looking forward to for a long time, from the day that I first shut that border right at the start of the pandemic," said Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison.

355.title: Justin Bieber tests +ve for COVID-19, postpones Justice World Tour concert
355.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber has tested positive for COVID-19. A representative for the singer told TMZ that he contracted the virus on Saturday but "thankfully is feeling OK". Bieber was supposed to perform in Las Vegas on Sunday as part of his Justice World Tour, but the show has now been rescheduled to June 28.

356.title: Kajal Aggarwal shares pictures from her baby shower
356.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal, who's expecting her first child with husband Gautam Kitchlu, shared some pictures from her baby shower on her Instagram Stories on Sunday. She also shared a picture with Gautam with a caption that read, "Godbharai." The couple announced the pregnancy in a cryptic post earlier this year. Kajal and Gautam tied the knot in October 2020.

357.title: Man blackmails, rapes wife’s minor sister in Noida; arrested
357.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his wife's 16-year-old sister in Noida. He allegedly blackmailed the victim using a clip of the sexual assault. According to police, the accused sexually assaulted the minor girl on several occasions since last April and also forced her to undergo an abortion when she became pregnant.

358.title: Consume cooked chicken, eggs without hesitation: Official on bird flu
358.article_body: President of Poultry Farmers & Breeders Association (Maharashtra), C Vasanthkumar, while speaking about bird flu, said consumers can consume cooked chicken and eggs without hesitation. "Infection is limited to particular area...Manner in which we prepare chicken is different from that in other countries...we cook it above 70 degrees Celsius...There is no chance of survival of pathogen," he said.

359.title: 24-yr-old Delhi woman murders mother after she threatens to disown her, held
359.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly murdering her mother in Delhi with her friend's help after her mother threatened to disown her. The accused had left her husband and was living with another man, police said, adding that her mother was not happy with this. The victim was frustrated as her mother had stopped helping her financially, police said.

360.title: World still doesn't make sense, I miss her greatly: Andrew on mother's death
360.article_body: Actor Andrew Garfield, while talking about losing his mother Lynn Garfield to cancer, said, "It is very, very difficult." "For period of time I didn't want to, and I wasn't able to, do anything. I was...wasted...world didn't make sense...it still doesn't, because I miss her greatly...I hope it never makes sense because I always want to miss her," he said.

361.title: YouTube star Jamal Edwards, whose channel launched Ed Sheeran's career, dies at 31
361.article_body: British music entrepreneur and YouTube star Jamal Edwards, whose channel launched careers of several musicians like Ed Sheeran, passed away at the age of 31. Edwards was also a director, author, DJ and designer, and he was awarded an MBE in 2014 for his work in music. The cause of his death is not known yet.

362.title: 16-year-old Grandmaster Praggnanandhaa defeats world number one Carlsen
362.article_body: India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the eighth round of the Airthings Masters, an online rapid chess tournament. Praggnanandhaa won with black pieces in 39 moves to halt Carlsen's run of three straight wins. The Indian Grandmaster is currently on the joint 12th spot in the tournment after eight rounds with eight points.

363.title: Trump's Truth Social app launches on Apple App Store
363.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's new social media venture, Truth Social, has been launched on Apple's App Store. The app was available to download shortly before midnight ET and was automatically downloaded to Apple devices belonging to users who had pre-ordered the app, Reuters reported. Notably, Trump was banned from Twitter, Facebook and YouTube following the 2021 US Capitol attack.

364.title: Bajrang Dal activist killed in K'taka's Shivamogga; Sec 144 imposed, schools shut
364.article_body: A 26-year-old Bajrang Dal activist named Harsha was allegedly murdered in Karnataka's Shivamogga on Sunday night. Following the incident, Shivamogga Deputy Commissioner said that Section 144 has been imposed in the area. "As a precautionary measure, schools and colleges in city limits have been closed for two days," Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said on Monday.

365.title: Maha BJP MLA & 35 others booked for taking out bike rally, violating COVID norms
365.article_body: BJP MLA from Maharashtra's Chikhali, Shweta Mahale Patil and her 35 women supporters were booked by the local police for taking out a bike rally on Saturday to celebrate Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's birth anniversary. They were booked for violating COVID-19 protocols. The permission was denied for the rally citing COVID-19 restrictions in the state, according to the local police.

366.title: Union Budget will help in implementing National Education Policy: PM
366.article_body: Union Budget will help in implementing the National Education Policy, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday. "National Digital University is an unprecedented step. The problem of shortage of seats can be resolved. There will be unlimited seats. I urge all the stakeholders to ensure digital uni starts as soon as possible," PM Modi added.

367.title: It was really emotional: Courteney Cox on 'Friends' reunion
367.article_body: Actress Courteney Cox recalled her experience of reuniting with her 'Friends' cast in the reunion special. She said, "We went through so many things together, everything from parents dying to marriages, divorces. It was such a period where so many changes took place." "The reunion was really emotional. I love these people. There's such history," Courteney said.

368.title: Unless on-screen, it's assumed you have kid; aren't interested for work: Bhumika
368.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla said that she needs to be "seen for producers and directors to understand" that she is still working. "Unless you're seen on-screen, people assume that you're married, you have a child, so you're not interested. So, social media and PR comes handy at that time," she said, adding, "I have three films due for release right now."

369.title: 10 embark on swimming expedition in Guj to raise marine life awareness
369.article_body: Ten swimmers have embarked on expedition from Gujarat's Dwarka to Somnath temple in Gir Somnath. Their aim is to raise awareness about marine life of Gujarat. Bankim Joshi, who has been coaching swimmers, said, "Objective is to draw children to nature...encourage them to look around, beyond mobile phones...highlight marine life and risk it faces from pollution and irresponsible fishing practices."

370.title: Pic of Rohit Sharma taking immediate review in 3rd T20I against West Indies goes viral
370.article_body: A picture of India captain Rohit Sharma taking a caught-behind review immediately in the third T20I against West Indies after the on-field umpire declared it not out has gone viral. Rohit can be seen bending down and taking the review animatedly. Reacting to the picture, a fan tweeted, "God level review." Another fan wrote, "Reminded me of Billy Bowden."

371.title: Anil Ambani's son Anmol Ambani marries Khrisha Shah in Mumbai, pic surfaces
371.article_body: Businessman Anil Ambani and Tina Ambani's son Anmol Ambani got married to Khrisha Shah in Mumbai.  GVK Vice Chairman GV Sanjay Reddy's wife Pinky Reddy took to Instagram to share photos from the event. Several personalities including actors Amitabh Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan and NCP MP Supriya Sule attended the wedding.

372.title: Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa' wins Film Of The Year award at DPIFF 2022
372.article_body: Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Pushpa: The Rise' bagged the Film Of The Year award at Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards (DPIFF) 2022. Directed by Sukumar, the action film also featured Fahadh Faasil and Rao Ramesh. Meanwhile, Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani-starrer film 'Shershaah' won the Best Film award. 'Shershaah' was directed by Vishnu Varadhan.

373.title: 2 ITBP personnel on patrol duty injured in IED blast in poll-bound Manipur
373.article_body: Two personnel of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) on election duty in Manipur were injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast in the Wangoo area of Kakching district. Police said the incident took place when an ITBP party along with Manipur Police personnel were conducting an area domination patrol. The injured personnel were admitted to a hospital in Kakching.

374.title: Bajrang Dal activist killed by Musalmaan goondas: Karnataka minister
374.article_body: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa said that he is very disturbed by the "murder of a Bajrang Dal activist". "He was killed by 'Musalmaan goondas' (Muslim goons). I'm going to Shivamogga now to analyse the situation. We'll not allow 'goondaism'," he added. The 26-year-old activist Harsha was allegedly murdered at around 9 pm on Sunday in Karnataka's Shivamogga.

375.title: India become world number one T20I team after 6 years
375.article_body: Following their 3-0 series victory against West Indies, India have become the world number one T20I team after six years. As per the latest update, India are on top of the rankings with 10,484 points and 269 rating points. England are second with 10,474 points and 269 rating points. India have won nine T20I matches in a row.

376.title: NPS India 2022 aims to eclipse NPS 2021 by offering more medals & prizes
376.article_body: National Poker Series India 2021 awarded 192 medals and saw 83,000+ entries, taking guaranteed ₹15-crore prize-pool to ₹19.4 crore. Mohd Azhar Tak (Rajasthan) topped NPS podium with 3 gold medals. Maharashtra (44), Delhi (37), Haryana (18) won most medals. NPS India 2022 revealed that it features 252 medals and 3 packages to Las Vegas with a guaranteed ₹18.5-crore starting prize-pool.

377.title: President Kovind receives 21-gun salute during Naval Fleet in Visakhapatnam
377.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind embarked on the Presidential Yacht INS Sumitra and received a 21-gun salute during the 12th edition of President's Fleet Review at the Eastern Naval Command, Visakhapatnam on Monday. The event was conducted as part of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav. The President reviewed the Indian Naval Fleet comprising over 60 ships and submarines and 55 aircraft.

378.title: 5 terrorists, 1 soldier killed in Pakistan's North Waziristan
378.article_body: Pakistan's security forces reportedly killed five terrorists in an encounter in North Waziristan on Sunday. One Pakistani soldier was also killed in the incident. "The killed terrorists were involved in terror activities against security forces, target killing and kidnapping for ransom," said officials. A huge cache of arms and ammunition including sub-machine guns and hand grenades was seized.

379.title: Dominican Republic starts building wall along border with Haiti
379.article_body: The Dominican Republic on Sunday started building a wall along the border it shares with Haiti. The 3.9 metres high wall will span nearly half of the 392 km border the two countries share. Dominican President Luis Abinader said the wall would help reduce smuggling of commercial goods, weapons and cross-border human trafficking.

380.title: Hrithik Roshan's rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad joins actor for family lunch, pic surfaces
380.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan's rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad joined the actor for a family lunch on Sunday, with the actor's uncle Rajesh Roshan sharing a picture on Instagram. Commenting on Rajesh Roshan's picture, Saba Azad wrote, "Bestest Sunday."  Several days ago, Hrithik's ex-wife Sussanne Khan had given Saba a shout-out on Instagram Stories for her performance at an event.

381.title: For months I didn't know Muskkaan was Jaaved Jaaferi's sister: Madhuri
381.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit recalled how Muskkaan Jaaferi, who plays her daughter in ‘The Fame Game’, never told her that she’s Jagdeep Jaaferi's daughter and Jaaved Jaaferi’s half-sister. Madhuri said, “We were halfway through the series when I got to know...I was like, ‘Why didn’t you tell me?’” and [Muskkaan] just said, “‘I want to be known as me’,” Madhuri added.

382.title: Andhra minister Mekapati Goutham Reddy passes away after suffering heart attack
382.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Industries and IT Minister Mekapati Goutham Reddy passed away aged 50 on Monday after suffering a heart attack. Reddy was shifted to Apollo Hospitals in Hyderabad, where the doctors declared him brought dead, the hospital said in a release. "CPR was done for more than 90 minutes. Despite our best efforts, he could not be revived," it added.

383.title: I am not hurt at all: Rahul Dravid on Saha making their private conversation public
383.article_body: Reacting to Wriddhiman Saha making his private conversation with Rahul Dravid about getting dropped public, the Team India head coach said, "I am actually not hurt at all. I have a deep respect for Saha and his achievements." Dravid added, "I didn’t want him to hear about [getting dropped] from the media...Sometimes you have difficult conversations with players."

384.title: Wridhi, you just name the person: Harbhajan as Saha shares journalist's threatening texts
384.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha shared a journalist's threatening texts to him after getting dropped from India Test team, former cricketer Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Wridhi, you just name the person so that the cricket community knows who operates like this." He added, "Else even the good ones will be put under suspicion...What kind of journalism is this?"

385.title: B'luru engineering student falls 300 feet at Nandi Hills, IAF's Mi17 helicopter saves him
385.article_body: A 19-year-old engineering student from Bengaluru who fell 300 feet into a gorge at Nandi Hills was rescued by the IAF on Sunday. IAF's Mi17 helicopter was launched and a flight gunner was lowered next to the survivor, who helped him harness and lifted him up. Visuals showed the area where Nishank was stuck and how he was lifted up.

386.title: Abhishek to play role of a cricket coach in Balki's 'Ghoomer': Reports
386.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan, who has teamed up with filmmaker R Balki for 'Ghoomer', will be seen playing the role of a cricket coach to Saiyami Kher in the upcoming project, as per reports. In addition to Abhishek and Saiyami, Shabana Azmi and Angad Bedi are also a part of the film, reports stated. 'Ghoomer' went on floors earlier this month.

387.title: Bajrang Dal activist stabbed to death in Shivamogga, sec 144 declared
387.article_body: A Bajrang Dal activist, Harsha, was allegedly stabbed to death on Sunday night in Karnataka’s Shivamogga, police said. "Section 144 has been declared in the area," Dr Selvamani R, Deputy Commissioner, Shivamogga said. "As a precautionary measure, schools and colleges in city limits have been closed for two days," Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said.

388.title: Facebook friend drugs woman in Chandigarh hotel, steals ₹10,000; held
388.article_body: Chandigarh police have arrested a man, Robin alias Saurabh, for allegedly cheating a woman in a hotel after befriending her on Facebook. The man reportedly also stole ₹10,000, cell phone and gold jewellery from the woman. Robin reportedly offered intoxicating drink to victim, after which, she felt dizzy and fell unconscious. Police have also recovered fake Aadhaar cards from Robin.

389.title: No political front to be made without Cong: Raut on anti-BJP front
389.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao met his Maharashtra counterpart Uddhav Thackeray and NCP chief Sharad Pawar to form an alliance opposing the BJP, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said on Monday that they never said that a political front will be formed without Congress. Furthermore, he said that KCR has the "ability to lead by taking everyone along".

390.title: Mumbai police arrest B'luru man who cheated teacher of ₹2.47 lakh
390.article_body: Mumbai's Matunga police have arrested a 31-year-old man for allegedly cheating a teacher of ₹2.47 lakh under the pretext of providing high returns through a crypto mining scheme. The accused had created an app and promised investors ₹2,000 per day returns, police said. The accused reportedly removed the app from PlayStore after a few days and didn't give any refund.

391.title: 4 of family including 2 kids found dead at home in Kerala; suicide suspected
391.article_body: Four members of a family, including two children, were found dead at their home in Kerala's Thrissur district. Police have recovered a suicide note from the spot which states that they were ending their lives due to financial liability. Prima facie, they seemed to have inhaled some toxic gas to end their lives, according to police.

392.title: Played Sanjay Dutt's mom in 'Rocky' & seduced him in his next film: Aruna
392.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani in an interview recalled how she played Sanjay Dutt's mother in his first film and "seduced him" in the next one. "I still don't understand how people used to accept it in those times and even now," she added. Aruna further said she enjoyed working with Sanjay Dutt. The actor made his debut in 1981 with 'Rocky'.

393.title: Journalists attacked, 20 people detained in Jajpur during panchayat polls
393.article_body: A few journalists were attacked during the third phase of polling in the panchayat elections in Odisha’s Jajpur, Chakravarti Singh Rathore, District Magistrate, Jajpur said. "More than 20 people have been detained. Further detention and arrests are underway," Rathore added. The third phase of Panchayati Raj Institutions (3-tier PRI) polls in Odisha was held on Sunday.

394.title: PM Modi wishes Queen Elizabeth II speedy recovery from COVID-19
394.article_body: A day after 95-year-old UK's Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for COVID-19, Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished her a speedy recovery. "I wish Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth a speedy recovery and pray for her good health," said Modi in a tweet. Earlier, Buckingham Palace said, "Her Majesty is experiencing mild cold-like symptoms but expects to continue light duties."

395.title: Big B thanks Prabhas for bringing him home-cooked food, says 'beyond delicious'
395.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan, who is currently shooting for his next with Prabhas, took to Twitter on Sunday and thanked the 'Bahubali' star for home-cooked food. Amitabh tweeted, "Bahubali Prabhas...your generosity is beyond measure...you bring me home-cooked food [which is] beyond delicious...you send me quantity beyond measure [that] could have fed an army...the special cookies...[are] beyond scrumptious."

396.title: ITBP Constable shoots self dead in Delhi, suicide note found
396.article_body: A 31-year-old Indo-Tibetan Border Police personnel allegedly shot himself dead using his service rifle on Sunday, officials said. Constable Y Reddy, who was on security duty at Delhi's Teen Murti Bhavan, had returned around two weeks ago after a 30-day leave. A purported suicide note was recovered where he accused his wife and father-in-law of mentally harassing him, officials added.

397.title: 24-yr-old woman arrested for getting her mother killed in south Delhi
397.article_body: A 24-yr-old woman has been arrested for getting her mother killed with the help of a man in south Delhi. The deceased, identified as 55-year-old Sudha Rani, was found lying covered in blood at her house in Madangir when police reached the scene on February 19. Officers found that Ms Rani was given sleeping pills before her throat was slit.

398.title: Man dies, brother injured in workshop fire in Delhi’s Dwarka
398.article_body: A 24-year-old man died and his elder brother suffered severe injuries after a fire broke out in a furniture workshop in Delhi's Dwarka on Sunday. According to officials, the fire was caused after a chemical drum exploded due to a short circuit. Two fire tenders reached the spot and doused the fire. The survivor is being treated at Safdarjung hospital.

399.title: Kejriwal buying votes by taking money from Khalistanis: BJP’s Adesh Gupta
399.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Sunday alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal was "buying votes by taking money from Khalistanis." "He (Kejriwal) is agreeing with whatever they say...He now calls himself the sweetest terrorist and it's right because he included in AAP those involved in Delhi riots," Gupta added.

400.title: If not Bhagavad Gita, should kids recite Fatawa-e-Allamgiri: Rane
400.article_body: BJP leader Nitesh Rane wrote to Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray over issue of recitation of Bhagavad Gita in BMC schools. "There is no doubt that recitation of Bhagavad Gita will help kids in the process of developing their personality. But if there is opposition to reciting Gita then should we ask our kids to recite Aurangzeb's Fatawa-e-Allamgiri?" Nitesh said.

401.title: Hijab protesters missing exams may not be allowed to reappear: K'taka official
401.article_body: Students protesting the hijab ban might not be allowed to reappear for the pre-university practical exams, starting Monday, if they miss it, a senior government official said. The exams were to start from February 17 but were postponed amid the hijab controversy, the official added. "The state has not issued any written notification in this regard," the official stated.

402.title: Death toll from flash floods and landslides rises to 152 in Brazil
402.article_body: The death toll from flash floods and landslides, triggered by torrential rains, in Brazil's Petrópolis rose to 152, authorities said on Sunday. Around 165 people still remain missing in the colonial city, according to the police. "I express my closeness to those people hit in previous days by natural calamities," Pope Francis said.

403.title: India reports 16,051 new COVID-19 cases, nearly 20% less than yesterday
403.article_body: India has reported 16,051 new COVID-19 cases and 206 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 19,968 cases and 673 deaths. India's daily positivity rate rose from 1.68% to 1.93% while the number of active cases declined to 2,02,131.

404.title: Time for BCCI President to dive in: Shastri on journalist's threatening texts to Saha
404.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha shared threatening WhatsApp texts he received from a journalist, Ravi Shastri tweeted, "Shocking a player being threatened by a journo." He added, "Blatant position abuse...Something that's happening too frequently with #TeamIndia. Time for...BCCI President...to dive in. Find out who the person is in interest of every cricketer. This is serious coming from ultimate team man."

405.title: 1 dead, 3 injured as speeding truck hits 2 cars, crashes into hotel in Guj
405.article_body: One person died and three others sustained injuries when a speeding truck lost control and hit two cars before crashing into a hotel in Palanpur in Gujarat's Banaskantha district. "The three injured were rushed to the Civil Hospital in Palanpur...The accident caused considerable damage to the front portion of Hotel Savera," a senior police officer said.

406.title: Today's girls, boys taught conduct in industry; we didn't have that: Deepika
406.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said today's 'girls and boys' are prepared when they enter the industry. "They are told how to stand, sit...how to conduct themselves, what to say, what not to say...what to wear, what not to wear, how they should do their hair...we didn't have any of that. We grew into it, we made...mistakes along way," she said.

407.title: Ranveer Singh gets Best Actor at DPIFF, Kriti Sanon bags Best Actress
407.article_body: Ranveer Singh was named Best Actor for '83', while Kriti Sanon bagged the Best Actress award for 'Mimi' at Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards 2022 (DPIFF). The awards for Critics Best Actress and Critics Best Actor went to Kiara Advani and Sidharth Malhotra for 'Shershaah'. Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards 2022 was held in Mumbai on Sunday.

408.title: Childless elderly couple dies by suicide in Tamil Nadu
408.article_body: An elderly couple died by suicide in Tamil Nadu after allegedly being "lonely". Deceased, 76-year-old Nambirajan, who was retired official of a private company, and 76-year-old Pappa, who was retired teacher, were childless. Police said couple was worried about their health and absence of a permanent caregiver. Nambirajan's brother said couple had earlier spoken about having suicidal tendencies.

409.title: It was a bold decision to not to star opposite Ranbir in 'Rocket...': Gauahar
409.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan said her choices as an actor have been quite wise. She added, "When I started out with 'Rocket Singh: Salesman of The Year', it was a...bold decision in itself not to be opposite Ranbir (Kapoor) but to portray a girl who stood out in the entire script." Gauahar said she was trained well with her first film.

410.title: Cricket betting racket busted in Pune; 6 arrested
410.article_body: Six persons were arrested when a cricket betting racket was busted in Pune's Gultekdi area. They were allegedly involved in betting on the India-West Indies T-20 International series. The police said they seized cash, laptop and other items worth ₹ 7.21 lakh during the raid. They also recovered a SIM card which was allegedly used to accept bets.

411.title: Kerala sees 3-fold rise in very heavy rainfall incidences since 2015: IMD data
411.article_body: Around a three-fold increase was witnessed in incidences of very heavy rainfall across the districts of Kerala since 2015, according to the IMD’s data. The coastal state witnessed 43 very heavy rainfall events in 2015, which increased to 115 in 2021. Very heavy rainfall events are categorised as days that experience rainfall between 115.6 mm and 204.4 mm.

412.title: 67-yr-old Mumbai woman files complaint against son for cheating her of ₹40 lakh
412.article_body: A 67-year-old woman in Mumbai's Santacruz has lodged a complaint against her son for allegedly cheating her of ₹40 lakh. The woman claimed her son had allegedly offered to sell her one-room flat and buy a new house in her name so he could shift there with his family. Later, she found out that the flat was in his name.

413.title: 3 persons called for inquiry into POCSO Act case attack Pune police
413.article_body: Three people allegedly attacked police at an outpost in Pune who had called them for an inquiry into a Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act case. The accused reportedly threw and tore papers related to the inquiry and attacked the staff, a police official said. Of the three accused, two men were arrested while the woman is absconding.

414.title: Biden, Putin agree to meet only if Russia does not invade Ukraine
414.article_body: US President Joe Biden and Russian President Vladimir Putin have accepted in principle to hold a summit to discuss "security and strategic stability in Europe," the French presidency has announced. The meeting can only happen if Russia does not invade Ukraine. The summit proposed by France President Emmanuel Macron will be expanded to relevant stakeholders, the official statement said.

415.title: Kidnapper offered lift to child in November, probe on: Pune police
415.article_body: A four-year-old child, who was abducted on January 11 and released hours later, was given a lift by the kidnapper two months before the incident in November, Pune police has said. "The kidnapper had given the child a lift in November. We have prepared a sketch and further investigation is on in the case," said police.

416.title: Suryakumar Yadav's celebration after scoring fifty goes viral
416.article_body: Team India middle-order batter Suryakumar Yadav's celebration after scoring a fifty in the third T20I against West Indies has gone viral on social media. The 31-year-old raised his bat and then bowed and folded his hands in 'Namaste' gesture. Suryakumar slammed 65 runs off 31 deliveries in the match, including seven sixes and a four.

417.title: Gym set up for personnel at Hyderabad's Karkhana police station
417.article_body: A gym was inaugurated at the Karkhana police station in Hyderabad on Saturday. The gym is reportedly equipped with yoga mats, cycling machine and treadmill. An official reportedly said that being fit is important for law enforcement officers and that the police personnel are being urged to spend at least one hour in the gym every day.

418.title: B'luru food delivery staff educated on traffic rules, wearing safe helmets
418.article_body: Bengaluru traffic police officials conducted an awareness programme with the food delivery staff at food stations. They were reportedly educated to ensure that they wear high-quality and safe helmets. The police also conducted the programme to ensure that the food delivery staff are aware of compliance with traffic rules. The police held a safe-helmet programme with other motorists too.

419.title: 8-yr-old boy dies after falling from balcony of high-rise building in Faridabad
419.article_body: An eight-year-old boy died after allegedly falling from the balcony of his flat in a high-rise building at a residential society in Faridabad. The boy was standing on a chair and leaning against the balcony's railing when he lost his balance and fell, police said. "It appears he was leaning over...to see the children who were playing," an officer said.

420.title: Did my hair, wear own clothes; didn't have PR agent: Deepika on early career
420.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said she had no PR agent or manager when she made debut in film industry. "I did my own hair and makeup, I used to wear my own clothes," she said, adding, "Today, girls and boys are completely prepared...They are told how to stand, how to sit, how to conduct themselves...we didn't have any of that."

421.title: 'Rags to Bags' exhibition in Bhayandar aims to reduce plastic use
421.article_body: The Mira Bhayandar Municipal Corporation (MBMC) has organised a 'Rags to Bags' exhibition with an aim to encourage people to replace plastic bags with eco-friendly ones. The two-day exhibition was inaugurated on Saturday at the Maxus Mall in Bhayandar (west) by mayor Jyotsna Hasnale.  The recycled bags displayed at the exhibition were manufactured by local Women Self Help Groups (SHG).

422.title: EC takes suo moto cognisance of poll code violation by Akhilesh
422.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) on Sunday took suo motu cognisance of violation of the Model Code of Conduct by Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav in UP. Yadav, who cast his vote for the Jaswantnagar seat, had allegedly interacted and shared his opinions with media personnel outside the polling booth. A complaint had been submitted against him earlier in Saifai.

423.title: 18 FIRs filed across Punjab during polls: Chief Electoral Officer
423.article_body: A total of 18 First Information Reports (FIRs) were registered across Punjab during the assembly polls on Sunday, Punjab Chief Electoral Officer S Karuna Raju said. He added, that the incidents were all minor and that the FIRs had been filed to avoid any untoward incidents. He further said, "The election was peaceful. It was like a festival here."

424.title: 19,000 Cong workers went to jail for people in 1.5 yrs: Priyanka
424.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli, Congress general secretary Priyanka Vadra said that 19,000 Congress workers went to jail for the people in the last 1.5 years. Congress will empower women if elected, she added. "We will waive off farmers' loans as in Chhattisgarh, halve the electricity bills," Vadra further said.

425.title: 5 people booked on charges of gang-rape, extortion in Punjab
425.article_body: Five people have been booked by police on the charges of gang-rape and extortion in Punjab. The charges come after a woman was reportedly gang-raped on February 16 after being taken to a deserted place at gunpoint by five people, who came in a car. The accused have been charged under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

426.title: India seen as powerful country because of BJP govt: Rajnath Singh
426.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Patti, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that people across the world look at India as a powerful country because of the BJP government's achievements. Singh stated that UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has done everything for the development of the state. "Yogi Adityanath is a more successful minister than me," he added.

427.title: Plot to deny education to Muslim girls: Ex-K'taka CM on hijab ban
427.article_body: Former Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Sunday said that the hijab ban was BJP's conspiracy to prevent Muslim girls from getting an education. "The code of uniform should have been prescribed at beginning of the session. Hijab ban in educational institutions in the month of January-February is deliberate and intentional," he further added.

428.title: Tripura Police bring back 2 con men after arresting them in Bihar
428.article_body: The Tripura Police brought back two con men to Agartala on Sunday after arresting them in Bihar where they were hiding. The accused were traced before a Crime Branch Unit team travelled to Bihar and arrested them in collaboration with local police. Speaking about the amount involved, police said, "As per...scheme, ₹5,000 was entitled to each of the beneficiaries."

429.title: 2022 a chance to see how ready I'm to win gold at 2024 Olympics: Lovlina
429.article_body: Boxer Lovlina Borgohain, who won a bronze medal at Tokyo Olympics, said she's more confident to do better at 2024 Paris Olympics. She added that World Championships, Asian Games and Commonwealth Games this year will give her an opportunity to check how ready she is and how much more she should do to win a gold medal at 2024 Olympics.

430.title: Kejriwal wants to rule, even if it means breaking the nation: Punjab CM
430.article_body: As single-phase voting for the 117-seat Punjab Assembly ended on Sunday, Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi said, "Kejriwal wants to rule, even if it means breaking the nation." He added, "Arvind Kejriwal has taken support from Khalistani outfits...from those who want to divide the nation...those who are against the country. This support is very dangerous."

431.title: Who was Gangubai Kathiawadi & what's the controversy around the movie on her?
431.article_body: Ganga Harjeevandas (aka Gangubai) Kathiawadi from Gujarat became popular as one of Mumbai's well-known and influential brothel owners in the 50s and 60s. She's known to have lobbied for commercial sex workers' rights and her adopted children have objected to her portrayal as a prostitute in her biopic. One of them said it affected reputation of his family's women members.

432.title: Nigerian airstrike leaves 7 children dead in Niger: Governor
432.article_body: An airstrike by Nigeria's military left 12 people, including seven children, dead and five others injured in neighbouring Niger, the Governor of Maradi said on Sunday. The attack took place in Nachadé village on Friday, a few kilometres from the border with Nigeria, the Governor added. The attack was aimed at bandits in the area, the Governor further said.

433.title: Police in Nepal fire tear gas to disperse protest over US grant
433.article_body: Police in Nepal's Kathmandu fired tear gas and water cannons on protesters who took to the streets to oppose a US-funded infrastructure programme that was presented for ratification in parliament on Sunday. Demonstrators rallied against a US government agency's $500 million grant, which would be used to fund civic projects, on grounds that it may undermine Nepal's laws and sovereignty.

434.title: Delhi records 570 COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in the last 24 hrs
434.article_body: Delhi reported 570 new COVID-19 cases and four related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,56,071. Moreover, 730 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 2,545 active cases. With four more deaths, the fatality count in Delhi has reached 26,101.

435.title: Dhull becomes 3rd Indian cricketer to score tons in each innings on Ranji Trophy debut
435.article_body: India's 2022 Under-19 World Cup-winning captain Yash Dhull has become the third Indian cricketer after Nari Contractor and Virag Awate to score hundreds in each innings on Ranji Trophy debut. The 19-year-old right-handed batter scored 113(150) innings and hit 113*(202) in the second innings. Dhull is overall the ninth batter to score hundreds in both innings of first-class debut.

436.title: Mehmood made my career & was also responsible for my downfall: Aruna
436.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani said, "People misunderstood that I got married to Mehmood and at that time, I didn't even try to clear things in public." She added she did not get films for around two years despite 'Caravan' and 'Bombay To Goa' being successful. "It's like Mehmood made my career and...was also responsible for my downfall," she jokingly said.

437.title: All indications Russia on brink of invading Ukraine: US Secy of State
437.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday said all signs suggested Russia is on brink of invading Ukraine but pledged to use every opportunity to stop Russia from going forth with it. This comes as Russia deployed up to 1.9 lakh troops near Ukraine. President Joe Biden was also prepared to engage with Russian President Vladimir Putin, added Blinken.

438.title: Saha shouldn’t have made private conversation with Sourav public: Snehasish Ganguly
438.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha made his private conversation with BCCI President Sourav Ganguly public, Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) secretary Snehasish Ganguly said, "He shouldn't have gone public with that." Saha had revealed that after he scored 61* against New Zealand in Kanpur in November 2021, Sourav texted him on WhatsApp saying, "As long as I'm here...you'd be in the team."

439.title: India tells families of embassy officials to leave Ukraine: Reports
439.article_body: Amid growing fears of the Russian invasion over Ukraine, India on Sunday told families of its embassy officials to return to the country, as per multiple reports. The Indian embassy in Kyiv had earlier today told all Indian students and Indian nationals whose stay isn't deemed essential to leave Ukraine temporarily. Students were asked to contact their student contractors.

440.title: Kamal opts out of Bigg Boss Ultimate due to clash with Vikram
440.article_body: South Indian actor Kamal Haasan has opted out of Bigg Boss Ultimate as his dates were overlapping with the "production and post-production" of his upcoming film 'Vikram'. "Considering the fact that some more days of shoot are left...it has become practically impossible to manage both Vikram and Bigg Boss together," the actor said in a statement.

441.title: I'm getting to point where I'm missing acting a little bit: Ben
441.article_body: Hollywood actor Ben Stiller has said that he is getting to a point where he is missing acting "a little bit". "It's been a few years [since I acted]. It hasn't been totally intentional except I really do enjoy directing and producing," he stated. "Lately, I've been exploring projects [and] making things as a director and producer," he added.

442.title: Mumbai logs 167 COVID-19 cases & no deaths in the last 24 hrs
442.article_body: Mumbai reported 167 new COVID-19 cases and no related deaths in the last 24 hours. Moreover, 286 COVID-19 recoveries were reported in Mumbai with the city currently having 1,511 active cases. Maharashtra reported 1,437 fresh COVID-19 cases on Sunday, taking the overall infection tally in the state to 78,58,431. Active cases in the state stand at 16,422.

443.title: Pakistan arrests 31 Indian fishermen, seizes 5 fishing boats
443.article_body: The Pakistan Maritime Security Agency (PMSA) on Sunday said that it has arrested 31 Indian fishermen and seized five boats for fishing in the country's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ). The arrests were made on Friday, the PMSA announced. The boats were towed to Karachi for further legal proceedings, the agency added.

444.title: Russian minister to speak to France's Le Drian on Feb 21: Report
444.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will speak with his French counterpart, Jean-Yves Le Drian over phone on February 21, said TASS news agency citing Russian Foreign Ministry. This comes as Russian President Vladimir Putin and French President Emmanuel Macron held talks over a diplomatic solution to Ukrainian crisis on Sunday. Meanwhile, Russia deployed up to 1.9 lakh troops near Ukraine.

445.title: India win their 9th T20I in a row, complete their 2nd straight T20I series whitewash
445.article_body: India defeated West Indies by 17 runs in the third T20I at Eden Gardens in Kolkata to register a 3-0 series whitewash. With this, India extended their winning streak in T20I cricket to nine matches. Further, India completed their second straight T20I series whitewash after having defeated New Zealand 3-0 in their previous T20I series.

446.title: Kasautii's 44-yr-old actor Cezanne to marry girlfriend, says 'No perfect age to get married'
446.article_body: Cezanne Khan, the 44-year-old actor best known for playing Anurag Basu in 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay', told TOI that he's planning to marry his girlfriend Afsheen this year. "We've been together for three years now...Had it not been for the pandemic, we would've been married by now," Khan said. "I feel there is no perfect age to get married," he added.

447.title: Ship with 4,000 luxury cars still burning mid-ocean as firefighters continue ops
447.article_body: A port official has said that firefighters are struggling to douse a fire that broke out on a vessel carrying thousands of luxury cars on Wednesday in the Atlantic Ocean. The Felicity Ace ship was carrying around 4,000 vehicles including Porsches and Audis, and some electric cars with lithium-ion batteries. It was not clear whether the batteries sparked the fire.

448.title: Govt to 'scrupulously' carry out background check of Air India's new CEO: Report
448.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) will "scrupulously" carry out a thorough background check of Air India's new CEO and MD Ilker Ayci, a Turkish national, PTI reported. Tata Group named Turkish Airlines' former Chairman Ayci as Air India's CEO. MHA carries out a thorough background check of all foreign nationals when they're appointed in the key positions, PTI added.

449.title: Father figure: Ajay Jadeja on Rohit giving up opening spot in 3rd T20I
449.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has praised Rohit Sharma after he gave up his opening spot to Ruturaj Gaikwad in India-West Indies third and final T20I, saying the India captain is a "magnanimous man". He added, "He's (Rohit) looking at this team like a father figure...he wants these new kids to get a better opportunity." Rohit batted at number four.

450.title: Italy recommends 4th COVID-19 shot for people with low immunity
450.article_body: Italian Health Ministry on Sunday recommended a fourth COVID-19 vaccine shot for individuals with a severely compromised immunity. People who have taken their first booster shot at least 120 days prior are eligible to take the next one, the ministry said. Booster doses have shown efficacy in preventing symptoms that would require hospitalisation and COVID-related fatalities, it added.

451.title: Israel to allow entry of unvaccinated tourists from March 1: PM
451.article_body: Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett on Sunday announced that Israel would allow unvaccinated tourists to enter the country from March 1. The tourists would be required to take COVID-19 tests before their flights and upon landing, he added. "We are seeing a constant decline in morbidity data, so it is time to gradually open up," he further said.

452.title: Sidhu & Majithia meet at Punjab poll booth, exchange pleasantries
452.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu exchanged brief pleasantries with his rival Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia after the two came face to face at a polling booth entrance in Amritsar. Sidhu and Majithia are both contesting the Amritsar East assembly seat. Majithia also shared a warm hug with BJP candidate Jagmohan Singh Raju at the venue.

453.title: US, UAE seek additional $4 bn in farming climate change investment
453.article_body: US Secretary of Agriculture Thomas Vilsack on Sunday said US, UAE pushed for additional $4 billion investment in Agriculture Innovation Mission for Climate (AIM for Climate) to make agriculture resilient to climate change. This comes after $4 billion investment was sought following its launch by both countries in November 2021. Aimed at climate-friendly farming, AIM is backed by 140 partners.

454.title: Pakistan PM to visit Russia on Feb 23-24 for 1st time in 23 years
454.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan will visit Russia on February 23-24 making the first visit by a Pakistan PM since 1999, Kremlin Press Secretary Dmitry Peskov said. Peskov added Khan will also visit Russian President Vladimir Putin. This comes after Islamabad and Moscow reportedly held talks last month to finalise a plan for President Putin's visit to Pakistan.

455.title: Akhilesh Yadav is today's Aurangzeb: Madhya Pradesh CM
455.article_body: Addressing a poll rally in UP's Deoria, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan compared Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav to Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb. "Akhilesh is today's Aurangzeb. One who wasn't loyal to his father, how will he be (loyal) to you," Chouhan said. "Mulayam (Singh Yadav) also said that no one has humiliated him the way Akhilesh did," he added.

456.title: New policy to cut green hydrogen cost by 40-50%: India's largest oil firm IOC
456.article_body: India's largest oil firm Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) has said that the offer to waive transmission charges on green energy will help cut the cost of manufacturing green hydrogen by 40-50%. The cost will go down further if electrolyzers are indigenously manufactured instead of the present practice of importing them, said Director for Research & Development S.S.V. Ramakumar.

457.title: 'Parivarvadis' spreading venom in name of caste: PM Modi in Hardoi
457.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing an election rally at Hardoi, UP, on Sunday said that the "parivarvadis" are "now spreading venom in the name of caste". He said this after accusing Samajwadi Party, which was in power in the state until 2017, of not letting him work for UP. "Such people fight with their own family for chair," he added.

458.title: Haven't spoken to them about my role in IPL: Wade on Gujarat Titans
458.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade, who was bought by Gujarat Titans for ₹2.4 crore in IPL 2022 mega auction, said he hasn't spoken to franchise about his role in IPL 2022. "But I would assume anywhere from opening down to seven I'm pretty comfortable with. It doesn't worry me too much," he added. Wade had a base price of ₹2 crore.

459.title: Israel names retired military general as new cyber security chief
459.article_body: Israel's cabinet on Sunday named retired military general Gaby Portnoy to head the country's National Cyber Directorate, the Prime Minister's Office said. 52-year-old Portnoy will head the country's main body charged with defending the cyberspace and ramping up its cyber strength. Portnoy served for 31 years in the armed forces before retiring as Brigadier-General of Israel Defense Forces.

460.title: Aarya Babbar argues with pilot after getting called to cockpit over a joke
460.article_body: Actor Aarya Babbar shared a video of a heated exchange he had with the pilot of the flight he was in. Babbar said he was called to the cockpit for cracking a joke. He's heard telling the pilot, "You wish to show your power...you want me to get up from my seat...come...talk to you when you have a problem."

461.title: 4 senior executives at Better.com resign amid reports of more layoffs in March
461.article_body: Four more senior executives of Better.com have resigned, three months after the company fired 900 employees over a Zoom call. The latest resignations include Clayton Carol, VP of Finance; Christian Wallace, Head of Real Estate; Paul Tyger, General Manager of Purchase; and Stephen Rosen, Head of Sales. Reports suggest that the company is preparing for a massive layoff next month.

462.title: It's been therapeutic: Taapsee on wrap of 'Woh Ladki Hai Kahaan'
462.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu on Sunday announced the wrap of her film 'Woh Ladki Hai Kahaan' on Instagram, calling it a therapeutic experience. The actress shared a series of monochrome pictures from the sets of the film, writing, "I had a blast being the badass ACP Komal Sharma!" The Arshad Syed directorial co-stars Pratik Gandhi and Prateik Babbar.

463.title: Enjoyed his batting more than mine: Venkatesh on Suryakumar's 65(31)
463.article_body: Praising teammate Suryakumar Yadav for his 31-ball 65 in India-West Indies third and final T20I, India all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer (35*) said he enjoyed Suryakumar's batting more than his. Venkatesh and Suryakumar stitched a 37-ball 91-run fifth wicket stand to help India post 184/5 in 20 overs. "Every shot of his (Suryakumar's) has a touch of grace," Venkatesh added.

464.title: Four Chinese fighter planes enter Taiwan's air defence zone
464.article_body: Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense said four fighter jets of China's People's Liberation Army Air Force entered Taiwan's Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ) on Friday. While Taiwanese air force issued radio warnings to Chinese jets, the military deployed air defence missile systems to monitor Chinese jets. Taiwan is a self-governed nation near China which China claims as its own territory.

465.title: Love Kangana's guts, but I'm not made for it: Surbhi on 'Lock Upp'
465.article_body: Actress Surbhi Chandna, speaking about being a part of the reality television show 'Lock Upp' hosted by actress Kangana Ranaut, said that she is not made for such things. The actress further said that she is extremely fond of Kangana and loves her guts. "If I get a chance I will watch it...this is an epic combination," Surbhi added.

466.title: Punjab will be Cong-free for 100 yrs due to Gandhi family: AAP candidate
466.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) candidate Kunwar Vijay Pratap Singh said on Sunday that Congress will be wiped out from Punjab. He added that party won't return to power for next 100 years due to the Gandhi family. Singh, who contested Assembly polls from Amritsar North, further said CM Charanjit Singh Channi's government has been "a flop show of 111 days".

467.title: PM Modi stops BJP leader from touching his feet at poll rally, video surfaces
467.article_body: PM Narendra Modi stopped BJP's Unnao District President Awadhesh Katiyar from touching his feet during a poll rally in Uttar Pradesh. In a video of PM's rally speech shared by BJP, Katiyar is seen bending down to touch PM's feet after presenting him with an idol of Lord Rama. PM is seen signalling Katiyar to stop.

468.title: Sehwag shares Rohit's 'Chal udhar bhaag' pic over journalist's threatening texts to Saha
468.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to social media to share Rohit Sharma's viral 'Chal udhar bhaag' picture after Wriddhiman Saha shared a screenshot of threatening WhatsApp texts from a journalist. "What I would have done and what Wriddhi should be doing next time the so called journalist dares to message him," Sehwag wrote alongside the picture.

469.title: Singers Sumedha Karmahe, Geet Sagar divorced in 2018: Report
469.article_body: Singers Sumedha Karmahe and Geet Sagar, who got married on July 11, 2016, got divorced in 2018 two years after their wedding, reported Hindustan Times. As per the report, the two never spoke about it but have confirmed the divorce now. "Yes, we are divorced...I wouldn't want to talk more about it," Sumedha said. Geet called it painful and hurtful.

470.title: We haven't been able to change party number image: Meet Bros
470.article_body: Musical duo Meet Bros, comprising Harmeet and Manmeet Singh, said they have been unable to change their "party number" image, despite composing several romantic songs. "[Image] breaks if you pick up an award," Harmeet said. "There's something called rage, songs that spread like wildfire...That's when your image changes," Manmeet Singh stated.

471.title: Quite a gesture from Rohit to let Ishan open with Gaikwad: Bhogle on 3rd T20I
471.article_body: Talking about India's innings in third T20I against West Indies, commentator Harsha Bhogle said it was quite a gesture from captain Rohit Sharma to let Ishan Kishan open innings with Ruturaj Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who is playing in his third T20I, scored four and Kishan hit 34, while Rohit batted at number four. India set a 185-run target for West Indies.

472.title: 16-yr-old girl on way to school raped in Jaipur, suspect arrested
472.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped by a youth in Jaipur while she was on her way to school. The victim alleged that she was sexually assaulted after a youth approached her and took her to an abandoned place. The police said that the accused was apprehended as soon as the teenage girl filed a complaint.

473.title: Disha Patani announces wrap on 'Ek Villain Returns', shares pics
473.article_body: Actress Disha Patani on Sunday took to Instagram Stories to announce a wrap on her film 'Ek Villain Returns' sharing pictures with her team. The Mohit Suri directorial also stars John Abraham, Arjun Kapoor and Tara Sutaria. John had finished shooting for 'Ek Villain Returns' in October 2021 and had called it a beautiful and seamless experience.

474.title: Whenever Rajinikanth & I finalise a film, I will announce: Boney
474.article_body: Taking to Twitter, producer Boney Kapoor dismissed the rumours of him collaborating with South Indian actor Rajinikanth. "Whenever we finalise a film to work together on, I shall be the first person to announce it. You will not have to get such 'leaked ideas'," Boney tweeted. The reports had stated that Boney will produce Rajinikanth's 170th film.

475.title: 2 J'khand workers killed, 2 hurt in boiler blast at TN prawn farm
475.article_body: Two Jharkhand labourers have died and two others have been seriously injured after a steam boiler at a prawn farm in Tamil Nadu exploded. The accident is said to have occurred at a private prawn farm in Thoduvai village near Sirkazhi around 12 pm on Sunday. A case has been registered by the Sirkazhi police and further investigation is underway.

476.title: Trump's social media 'Truth Social' app likely to be released tomorrow: Report
476.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's social media app 'Truth Social' is expected to launch in Apple's App Store on Monday, as per Reuters. The app will mark Trump's return to social media after he was banned from Twitter, Facebook and YouTube last year following the attack on Capitol on January 6. The app pledged to deliver a "censorship-free experience".

477.title: I was dancing when Jersey's new release date was announced: Mrunal
477.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur said that she was happy when the makers of 'Jersey' announced the new release date. "I was literally dancing. But I am more nervous because the release is coming closer," she stated. 'Jersey' will release on April 14. 'Jersey' was set to release on December 31, however, it got postponed due to a surge in COVID-19 cases.

478.title: 63.44% voter turnout in Punjab; 57.58% in UP polls' 3rd phase till 5 pm
478.article_body: A voter turnout of 63.44% was recorded in Punjab till 5 pm while UP's third phase of polling witnessed a turnout of 57.58% on Sunday. In Punjab, the highest turnout was reported in Mansa constituency at 73.45%, followed by Malerkotla at 72.84%. In UP, the highest turnout was reported in Lalitpur at 67.38%, followed by 62.02% in Mahoba, PTI reported.

479.title: Only Nadal can beat Medvedev, even Novak easily lost to Russian: Opelka
479.article_body: World number 20 Reilly Opelka said only Rafael Nadal is capable of beating Daniil Medvedev as Novak Djokovic was easily beaten by the world number two at 2021 US Open. The Spaniard beat Medvedev at 2022 Australian Open to win his 21st Grand Slam title, the most in men's singles. Opelka lost to Medvedev at 2021 French Open third round.

480.title: Mysuru college cancels uniform rule to allow students with hijab
480.article_body: A private college in Mysuru has cancelled the uniform rule prescribed by Karnataka High Court, which bans hijabs, saffron shawls or any religious clothing inside classrooms. DDPU announced that it was cancelling its uniform rule to allow Muslim girls to attend classes wearing headscarves. The college is said to be the first in the state to take this decision.

481.title: BJP to call 72-hr bandh if WB civic polls voting blocked: Suvendu
481.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari warned the TMC-led government of a 72-hour bandh if voting is blocked on February 27, the day of West Bengal civic polls. While campaigning in Bengal, Adhikari said, "Everything will be blocked after 6 pm in Nimtala, Maniktala...other areas," if voting is blocked.  BJP has earlier claimed several instances of candidates being intimidated or threatened.

482.title: IPL media rights valuation will mirror rise, growth of league: Jay Shah
482.article_body: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said IPL media rights "will mirror rise and growth of league", especially after the addition of two new teams and strong digital growth. He added that BCCI will float tenders for expanded league's media rights for 2023-27 cycle as early as coming week. Star India, owned by Walt Disney Company, paid ₹163.48 billion for 2018-22 cycle.

483.title: How does the medal tally read after the Winter Olympics 2022 ends?
483.article_body: The Winter Olympics 2022 came to an end in Beijing on Sunday. Norway led the medal tally with 16 golds, eight silvers and 13 bronze medals. Germany finished second and host China finished third. China was followed by the US, Sweden, the Netherlands, Austria, Switzerland and ROC. Skier Arif Khan, India's only candidate at the games, didn't win a medal.

484.title: Katrina and I had mix of both cultures in our early days: Deepika
484.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has said that she didn't have a PR agent or manager in her early days, adding that she along with Katrina Kaif had a mixture of both cultures. "I did my own hair and makeup, I used to wear my own clothes," Deepika said. She added that the PR culture came in and they adapted to it.

485.title: Can't forget that moment: PM Modi on 2008 Ahmedabad blasts
485.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while campaigning in UP's Hardoi on Sunday, recalled the 2008 Ahmedabad blasts that occurred when he was Gujarat CM, saying he "can't forget that moment". He added, "I'd pledged my government will find these people and punish them, even from hell." On Friday, a Special Court sentenced 38 people to death for the blasts that killed 56.

486.title: Malta PM Abela calls for parliamentary elections on March 26
486.article_body: Malta's PM and Leader of Labour Party Robert Abela on Sunday said the country will hold parliamentary elections on March 26. "The future is bright because we're strong in the present," Abela addressed a rally near capital Valletta. While the results will be declared on March 27, opinion polls predict a successive third term for Abela's centre-left Labour Party.

487.title: CM-candidate insecure about his seat: PM Modi on Akhilesh Yadav
487.article_body: Criticising SP chief Akhilesh Yadav, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said, "If the chief ministerial candidate himself is insecure about his constituency, you can gauge the direction of the wind." "The seat, which these people considered as the safest, is also getting out of their reach," he added. Yadav is contesting the 2022 UP Assembly election from the Karhal constituency.

488.title: Russia and France agree to work for East Ukraine ceasefire amid clashes
488.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin agreed in a call on Sunday to work for a ceasefire in eastern Ukraine where pro-Russia separatists and Ukrainian forces clashed in recent days. They also agreed on "the need to find a diplomatic solution to the ongoing crisis and to do everything to achieve one", Macron's office said.

489.title: 'Exceptionally rare' 15.10-carat blue diamond to be auctioned in Hong Kong
489.article_body: A 15.10-carat blue diamond described as "exceptionally rare" will be auctioned by Sotheby's in Hong Kong in April. It's the largest vivid blue diamond ever to appear at an auction and also one of the most valuable blue diamonds, Sotheby's said. Only five blue diamonds over 10 carats have ever come to auction, none of which have exceeded 15 carats.

490.title: When I read 'The Marvels', I was like this is bonkers: Brie Larson
490.article_body: Actress Brie Larson, who portrays Captain Marvel in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has said that when she first read the script of 'The Marvels', she couldn't believe what she was reading. "I was like, this is bonkers," the actress added. Brie further said that the thing that she loves about Marvel is that they continue to reinvent.

491.title: Russia, Cuba to strengthen ties amid Ukraine crisis: Cuban govt
491.article_body: Cuban foreign ministry on Friday said Russia, Cuba will deepen ties and explore collaboration in transportation, energy following a visit by Russian Deputy Prime Minister Yury Borisov. "Cuba reiterates its position against unilateral and unjust sanctions imposed by the West on the Eurasian country..." stated the ministry. Meanwhile, tensions remain high between the West and Russia over Ukraine.

492.title: Nicole Kidman features on 'Vanity Fair' cover, fans call pic 'photoshopped'
492.article_body: 'Vanity Fair' took to Instagram to share its recent cover featuring actress Nicole Kidman along with a video of her photoshoot. The cover showed Kidman wearing a black mini skirt along with a bra top to which several users commented that the image had been photoshopped. "The airbrushing on her face makes her look like another person," commented a fan.

493.title: ECI restores number of star campaigners as COVID-19 cases decline
493.article_body: Amid decline in COVID-19 infections, Election Commission of India (ECI) on Sunday decided to restore the maximum limit of star campaigners for ongoing and future elections. Recognised national and state-level parties can field maximum of 40 campaigners, while other registered parties can field 20 campaigners. List of additional campaigners may be submitted to ECI by 5 pm on February 23.

494.title: We could've done better in the T20I series vs Australia: Shanaka
494.article_body: Following a 4-1 loss against Australia in the T20I series, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said, "The boys played...well throughout the series, they made a clear statement." "Unfortunately, we missed a few players in between, we could have done better this series," he added. Sri Lanka avoided a series whitewash against Australia after winning the fifth T20I by five wickets.

495.title: Brain's processing speed remains high until age 60: German study
495.article_body: German researchers found brain's processing speed remains high till age 60. Team analysed over 10 lakh participants and measured their reaction times to a cognitive task. Researchers said slow response times were due to increases in decision caution, slower body movement. Earlier, people had attributed the slower response to mental speed which was believed to have peaked at age 20.

496.title: It's time to implement sanctions against Russia: Ukraine to West
496.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Sunday said that it's time for the West to implement at least part of the sanctions it has prepared against Russia. "Russia has to be stopped right now. We see how events are unfolding," he added. Notably, Kuleba made the comment after Russia and Belarus announced an extension of their military drills near Ukraine.

497.title: Tata Technologies to hire 1,000 more people in FY 2023: CEO
497.article_body: Tata Technologies will hire at least 1,000 more people in FY2023 than its planned recruitment of over 3,000 innovators over 12 months under its expanded talent acquisition program, said CEO Warren Harris. "That speaks to the fact that increasingly, we are not opportunities constrained," he added. The company had announced its decision to recruit over 3,000 people in January.

498.title: Djokovic should either get vaccinated or stay at home: Panatta
498.article_body: Former Roland Garros winner Adriano Panatta said that Novak Djokovic should either get the COVID-19 vaccine or stay at home. This comes after Valentina Vezzali, Italy's cabinet undersecretary for sports, stated Djokovic could be allowed to play in the 2022 Rome Masters despite not being vaccinated. "Allowing his participation...causes more...confusion by giving the wrong message," Panatta added.

499.title: Rahane, Pujara, Ishant, Saha were told in advance: Chetan on dropping them
499.article_body: Team India's chief selector Chetan Sharma said the decision of dropping senior players like Cheteshwar Pujara, Ishant Sharma, Wriddhiman Saha, Ajinkya Rahane from the Test series against Sri Lanka was taken after "much deliberation". "We've spoken to them soon after the South Africa series, we told them...we'll not consider them for the two Test matches against Sri Lanka," he added.

500.title: My wife doesn't listen to me: Ashneer on wife wearing dress by designer he rejected
500.article_body: After Ashneer Grover's wife wore a dress designed by a 'Shark Tank' contestant he'd rejected, he addressed accusations of hypocrisy, saying, "Clearly my wife has a mind of her own and...doesn't listen to me." He said the designer left a dress for his wife Madhuri, adding, "I don't know what [she] liked, she wore it to 'The Kapil Sharma Show'."

501.title: UK ends mandatory self-isolation for COVID-19 +ve people
501.article_body: Individuals who test positive for COVID-19 in the UK will not be legally required to self-isolate from next week onwards, the government announced. The move comes as part of government's "Living with COVID" plan, which may also lead to reduced testing for coronavirus. The UK government has already scrapped vaccine passports and mask mandates for most venues, apart from hospitals.

502.title: Iranian lawmakers set 6 conditions to revive 2015 nuclear deal
502.article_body: In a letter to Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi, 250 Iranian lawmakers have laid out six conditions for the revival of the 2015 nuclear deal with global powers. One of the conditions is that the US and European parties should guarantee they wouldn't exit a restored agreement. Talks to revive the nuclear deal are being held in Vienna.

503.title: Was expected: Gavaskar on Pujara, Rahane being dropped for SL Tests
503.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said "it was expected" for batters Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane to be dropped from Team India's squad for the upcoming Test series against Sri Lanka. "If in the three Tests in South Africa, one of them had hit a century or played an innings of 80-90 runs...it would have been a different matter," Gavaskar stated.

504.title: James Faulkner should have been taken into 2-day custody: Salman Butt
504.article_body: Following James Faulkner's withdrawal from PSL 2022 over a payment dispute, ex-Pakistan captain Salman Butt opined that the Pakistan Cricket Board should have handled the matter legally. "Faulkner threw his helmet onto a chandelier...destroyed hotel property...also misbehaved with people over there. According to me, Faulkner should have been taken into two-day custody," Butt stated.

505.title: Great choice: Vaughan on Rohit's appointment as India's new Test captain
505.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan took to Twitter to talk about BCCI's decision of appointing Rohit Sharma as India's new Test captain, writing, "Great choice." The announcement was made on Saturday after chief selector Chetan Sharma named the 18-member squad for the two-match Test series against Sri Lanka, beginning March 4. Rohit has replaced Virat Kohli as the Test captain.

506.title: 4 Naxal supporters caught transporting explosives in Maharashtra
506.article_body: Four Naxal supporters have been apprehended in an anti-Naxal operation carried out in the Gadchiroli district of Maharashtra on Saturday. The group was reportedly caught transporting huge amounts of explosives from Telangana to Chhattisgarh. Police said Naxals were planning the extensive use of explosives in their forthcoming tactical counter-offensive campaign (TCOC), which they hold every year.

507.title: SP, Cong are soft on terror, address Osama as 'Ji': PM Modi in UP
507.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound UP's Hardoi, PM Narendra Modi alleged on Sunday that the Samajwadi Party (SP) and Congress are sympathetic towards terrorists and "address terrorists like Osama bin Laden as ‘Ji’". PM Modi further alleged that SP had withdrawn cases against several terrorists accused of carrying out attacks in UP. "SP...didn't allow trials against [terrorists]," he added.

508.title: Video of Jhingan saying 'Played with women' after ISL match goes viral; clarifies
508.article_body: A video of ATK Mohun Bagan defender Sandesh Jhingan saying 'Played with women' after their 2-2 draw against Kerala Blasters in ISL went viral. Jhingan issued a clarification, tweeting, "I told my teammate not to make excuses...so anyone taking my comment differently is only doing it to tarnish my name." He further wrote, "If...my comments have hurt anyone...my apologies."

509.title: Amazon, Reliance to compete for IPL telecast rights for a record ₹50,000 cr: Report
509.article_body: Amazon and Reliance Industries are expected to take on Sony Group and Walt Disney's India units for exclusive five-year TV and digital broadcast rights of IPL, Reuters reported on Sunday. The cost to acquire these rights could run to a record ₹50,000 crore, the report added. Disney-owned Star India paid ₹16,348 crore in 2017 to have these rights until 2022.

510.title: We've to bring India on right path: Maharashtra CM on anti-BJP front
510.article_body: After meeting Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao to discuss an anti-BJP front, Maharashtra CM said, "We've to bring our country on the right path. Who [will be PM] can be discussed later." In an apparent criticism of BJP, he said, "Our Hindutva doesn't teach wrong politics. Some people only work for their agendas, even if the country goes to hell."

511.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against West Indies, make 4 changes
511.article_body: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in third T20I at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. India have made four changes to their playing XI, with Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Yuzvendra Chahal being replaced by Shreyas Iyer, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Avesh Khan and Shardul Thakur. Avesh is making his India debut.

512.title: BlackBerry 5G smartphone to no longer be made as startup behind it shuts down
512.article_body: OnwardMobility, the US-based company licensed to make new BlackBerry smartphones, has announced that it is shutting down. It confirmed that it will no longer be proceeding with the development of an ultra-secure BlackBerry 5G smartphone with a physical keyboard, which it had delayed earlier. "This was not a decision that we made lightly or in haste," OnwardMobility said.

513.title: Video shows rescue of 22 crew members after ship carrying luxury cars catches fire
513.article_body: The Portuguese Air Force released a video of how the 22 crew members onboard the ship carrying thousands of luxury cars were rescued after the vessel caught fire. The crew was lifted from Felicity Ace to an oil tanker before they were transported to Faial Island. Portugal's navy was quoted as saying that no one was hurt in the fire.

514.title: My Bat-Voice was atrocious, they told me to stop doing it: Robert
514.article_body: Actor Robert Pattinson, who will portray the titular superhero in upcoming film 'The Batman', has said that he tried to do something "radically different" with his Bat-Voice. "Everyone does this...gruff, gravelly thing, and I'm like, 'I'm going to...go really whispery'," the actor said. Robert added that it looked "absolutely atrocious" and was told to stop doing it after two weeks.

515.title: There'll be pressure on David when he plays for MI in IPL 2022: Watson
515.article_body: Talking about Tim David, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said there'll be pressure on the Singapore all-rounder when he plays for Mumbai Indians in IPL 2022. "It's not until you get into...game time when you really know how to absorb that pressure that's there," he added. The Singapore-born Australian was bought for ₹8.25 crore by MI in IPL 2022 mega auction.

516.title: Dalit groups hold protest in Bengaluru over Ambedkar photo row
516.article_body: Dalit groups held a massive protest march in Bengaluru on Saturday against a judge who objected to placing BR Ambedkar's portrait next to Mahatma Gandhi's on Republic Day in Raichur. The protestors demanded that the Karnataka district judge be suspended. The huge rally subsequently prompted Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to meet the protesters in Freedom Park and accept their memorandum.

517.title: People dumping garbage in public places to be fined ₹500 in Ghaziabad
517.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation will impose a ₹500 fine on people dumping garbage in public places, with about 200 staff having the power to penalise violators. The municipal authority plans to set up a plastic waste collection centre in each of the five zones of Ghaziabad by March. Ghaziabad generates about 1,200 metric tonnes of solid waste daily, a report said.

518.title: Mandaviya pays surprise visit to 'Jan Aushadhi Kendra' in Mumbai
518.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya conducted a surprise inspection of a 'Jan Aushadhi Kendra' in Mumbai on Sunday. These medical stores are locally known as 'Modi Ji ki shop', 'Modi Medical,' his official Twitter handle said. Mandaviya, who is on a two-day visit to Mumbai from Saturday, will conclude his visit at All India Institute of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation.

519.title: Passenger found alive in burning ferry off Greece
519.article_body: A passenger was found alive on the stern of a still burning passenger ferry off Greece, the Greek coast guard said on Sunday. At least 281 out of 292 passengers and crew have been rescued from the ferry since the fire began on Friday. Eleven people are still missing, according to the coast guard and the ferry operator.

520.title: Russia & Belarus extend joint military drills amid Ukraine tensions
520.article_body: Belarus said on Sunday that joint military exercises with Russia have been extended amid rising tensions in eastern Ukraine's Donbas region. Russia had deployed an estimated 30,000 troops in Belarus, which borders Ukraine to the north, for the drills that were supposed to conclude today. On Saturday, multiple explosions were heard in Donbas' Donetsk, a city controlled by pro-Russian separatists.

521.title: BEST's Chalo app for bus tickets now available for iPhone users
521.article_body: The BEST's Chalo App for Mumbai bus commuters, which was launched for Android users last year, has now been launched on the iOS platform as well. "Chalo App for BEST bus tickets, bus passes, live tracking and passenger capacity is available for iPhone users," the bus service announced on Twitter. The app also notifies users of route changes and diversions.

522.title: Actor Cezanne Khan to marry girlfriend Afsheen later this year
522.article_body: Actor Cezanne Khan, who portrayed Anurag Basu in the original 'Kasautii Zindagi Kay', has revealed that he will be marrying his girlfriend Afsheen later this year.
